passages.1:1: Blessed is the man who does not walk in the advice of [the] wicked; nor does he stand in [the] way of sinners; nor does he sit in [the] assembly of mockers.
passages.1:2: Instead, in the law of Yahweh [is] his delight, and on his law he meditates day and night.
passages.1:3: And so, he is like a tree planted by streams of water that gives its fruit in its season; its leaf also does not wither. Therefore all that he does prospers.
passages.1:4: Not so the wicked. Instead, [they are] like the chaff that [the] wind scatters.
passages.1:5: Therefore [the] wicked will not stand in the judgment, nor sinners in the congregation of [the] righteous;
passages.1:6: for Yahweh knows [the] way of [the] righteous,<note: Plural> but [the] way of [the] wicked will perish.
passages.2:1: Why are nations in tumult, and countries plotting<note: Or "muttering"> in vain?<note: Or "an empty thing">
passages.2:2: [The] kings of [the] earth establish themselves, and the rulers conspire<note: Or "make themselves firm"> together against Yahweh and his anointed:
passages.2:3: "Let us tear off their bonds, and cast their cords from us!"
passages.2:4: [He who] sits [enthroned] in the heavens laughs. The Lord derides them.
passages.2:5: Then he speaks to them in his wrath, and in his fury he terrifies them:
passages.2:6: "But as for me, I have set my king on Zion, my holy mountain."
passages.2:7: I will tell the decree; Yahweh said to me: "You are my son; today I have begotten you.
passages.2:8: Ask from me and I will make [the] nations your heritage, and your possession [the] ends of [the] earth.
passages.2:9: You will break them with an iron rod. Like a potter's vessel you will shatter them."
passages.2:10: So then, O kings, be wise. Be warned, O rulers of [the] earth.
passages.2:11: Serve Yahweh with fear, and rejoice with trembling.
passages.2:12: Kiss the Son lest he be angry and you perish [on the] way, for his anger burns quickly. Blessed are all [who] take refuge in him.
passages.3:title: A psalm of David at his fleeing from the presence of Absalom, his son.<note: The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by one>
passages.3:1: Yahweh, how many are my enemies; many [are] rising against me.
passages.3:2: Many [are] saying about my soul, "There is no deliverance for him from<note: Or "in"> God. Selah<note: Meaning uncertain; probably a musical or liturgical direction>
passages.3:3: But<note: Or "And"> you, Yahweh, [are] a shield around me, my glory and the one who lifts up my head.
passages.3:4: [With] my voice I call to Yahweh and he answers me from {his holy hill}.<note: Literally "the hill of his holiness"> Selah
passages.3:5: I lay down and slept; I woke up because Yahweh sustains me.
passages.3:6: I am not afraid of the ten thousands of people who all around have set themselves against me.
passages.3:7: Rise up, O Yahweh; deliver me, O my God; for you strike all my enemies [on the] cheek. [The] teeth of [the] wicked you break.
passages.3:8: To Yahweh belongs deliverance; [may] your blessing [be] over your people. Selah
passages.4:title: For the [music] director; with stringed instruments. A psalm of David.<note: The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by one>
passages.4:1: When I call, answer me, O God of my righteousness.<note: Or "vindication"> In trouble {deliver me}.<note: Literally "make wide for me"> Be gracious to me and hear my prayer.
passages.4:2: O sons of man, how long will my honor<note: Or "glory"> be a disgrace? [How long] will you love vanity? [How long] will you seek lies?<note: Or "falsehood"> Selah
passages.4:3: But know that Yahweh has set apart<note: Or "treated specially"> for himself [the] faithful one.<note: Or "pious, godly one"> Yahweh hears when I call to him.
passages.4:4: Be disturbed but do not sin. Commune in your heart<note: That is, "think it over"> on your bed and be silent. Selah
passages.4:5: Offer correct sacrifices,<note: Or "right sacrifices"> and {trust in}<note: Literally "trust to"> Yahweh.
passages.4:6: Many are saying, "Who will show us [something] good?" Lift up over<note: Or "upon"> us the light of your face, O Yahweh.
passages.4:7: You have put gladness in my heart more than {when}<note: Literally "the time of"> their grain and their wine abound.
passages.4:8: In peace I will lie down and sleep {at once},<note: Literally "together"> for you alone, O Yahweh, make me dwell safely.
passages.5:title: For the [music] director; with the flutes. A psalm of David.<note: The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by one>
passages.5:1: Hear my words, O Yahweh. Give heed to my sighing.<note: Or "murmuring">
passages.5:2: Listen to the sound of my pleading,<note: Or "cry for help"> my king and my God, for to you I pray.
passages.5:3: O Yahweh, in [the] morning you will hear my voice. In [the] morning I will set forth<note: Or "present"> [my case] to you and I will watch.<note: Or "look expectantly">
passages.5:4: For you [are] not a God [who] desires<note: Or "takes delight in"> wickedness. Evil cannot dwell with you.
passages.5:5: The boastful do not stand before<note: Or "in front of"> your eyes. You hate all evildoers.
passages.5:6: You destroy speakers of lies.<note: Hebrew "lie"> {A man of bloodshed}<note: Literally "a man of bloods"> and deceit Yahweh abhors.
passages.5:7: {But as for me},<note: Literally "And I"> through the abundance of your steadfast love<note: Or "covenant love"> I will enter your house.<note: Or "temple"> I will bow down<note: Or "I will worship"> toward {your holy temple}<note: Literally "the temple of your holiness"> in awe [of] you.
passages.5:8: O Yahweh, lead me in your righteousness because of my enemies; make straight before me your way.
passages.5:9: For there is not [anything] reliable in his mouth; their inner part [is] destruction.<note: Hebrew "destructions"> Their throat is an open grave; [with] their tongue they speak deceit.<note: Or "flattery; smooth words">
passages.5:10: Treat them as guilty, O God; let them fall because of their plans. Because of the abundance of their transgressions cast them out, for they have rebelled against you.
passages.5:11: But let all who take shelter in you rejoice. Let them ever<note: Or "perpetually"> sing for joy, {because}<note: Literally "and"> you spread protection over them; And let those<note: Or "So that those"> [who] love your name exult in you.
passages.5:12: For you bless [the] righteous. O Yahweh, like a<note: Hebrew "the"> shield you surround him [with] good favor.
passages.6:title: For the [music] director; with stringed instruments, on the Sheminith.<note: Hebrew "upon the eighth"; meaning uncertain> A psalm of David.<note: The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by one>
passages.6:1: O Yahweh, do not rebuke me in your anger, and do not discipline me in your wrath.
passages.6:2: Be gracious to me, O Yahweh, because I am feeble. Heal me, O Yahweh, for my bones are terrified.
passages.6:3: My soul is also very terrified. But you, O Yahweh, how long?
passages.6:4: Turn, O Yahweh; deliver my life.<note: Or "my soul"; same word as in v. 3> Save me for the sake of your steadfast love.<note: Or "loyal love">
passages.6:5: For there is no remembrance of you in death. In Sheol, who will give thanks to you?
passages.6:6: I am weary with my groaning; {I flood}<note: Literally "I make my bed float"> my bed every night. With my tears {I drench}<note: Literally "I cause to melt"> my couch.
passages.6:7: My eye wastes away because of vexation; it grows old because of all my oppressors.
passages.6:8: Depart from me, all workers of evil, for Yahweh has heard the sound of my weeping.
passages.6:9: Yahweh has heard my plea; Yahweh has accepted my prayer.
passages.6:10: All my enemies shall be ashamed and shall be very terrified. They shall turn back; they shall suddenly be ashamed.
passages.7:title: A Shiggaion<note: Meaning uncertain; perhaps a lamentation> of David which he sang to Yahweh on account of Cush, a Benjaminite.<note: The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by one>
passages.7:1: O Yahweh, my God, in you I have taken refuge. Save me from all [who] pursue me, and deliver me.
passages.7:2: Or else he will tear me apart like a lion, ripping to pieces, with none [to] deliver.
passages.7:3: O Yahweh, my God, if I have done this, if there is wrong in my hands,
passages.7:4: if I have repaid {my ally}<note: Literally "[one] being at peace with me"> [with] harm, or [if] I have plundered my enemy without cause,
passages.7:5: let the enemy of my soul pursue, and overtake and trample my life into the ground, and lay my honor in the dust. Selah
passages.7:6: Rise up, O Yahweh, in your anger, and lift yourself up against the wrath<note: Or "outbursts"> of my oppressors, and awake for me, since you have commanded judgment.
passages.7:7: And let [the] assembly of peoples surround you, and over it return on high.
passages.7:8: Yahweh judges the nations. O Yahweh, vindicate me according to my innocence<note: Or "righteousness"> and according to my integrity within me.
passages.7:9: Let the evil of the wicked come to an end, but establish [the] righteous, and test the hearts and innermost being, O righteous God.
passages.7:10: My shield [is] with God who saves the upright of heart.
passages.7:11: God [is] a righteous judge, and a God who has indignation every day.
passages.7:12: If he<note: That is, a person> does not repent, he<note: That is, God> will sharpen his sword. He has bent his bow and he has {strung}<note: Literally "prepared"> it.
passages.7:13: And he has prepared for him weapons of death. He has made his arrows fiery shafts.
passages.7:14: See, he<note: That is, the wicked> travails with<note: Or "conceives"> evil. He is pregnant with trouble, and he gives birth to deception.
passages.7:15: He makes a pit and digs it out, then falls in [the] trap he has made.
passages.7:16: His trouble comes back on his head, and his violence comes down on his skull.
passages.7:17: I will thank Yahweh according to his righteousness, and I will sing praise to the name of Yahweh, [the] Most High.
passages.8:title: For the [music] director, on the Gittith.<note: Meaning uncertain> A psalm of David.<note: The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by one>
passages.8:1: Yahweh, our Lord, how majestic [is] your name in all the earth, who put your splendor above the heavens.
passages.8:2: From the mouth of children and infants you have founded<note: Or "ordained"> strength on account of your enemies, to silence [the] enemy and [the] avenger.
passages.8:3: When I look at your heavens, the work of your fingers, [the] moon and [the] stars which you set in place--
passages.8:4: what [is] a human being that you think of him? and a child of humankind that you care for him?
passages.8:5: And you made him a little lower than heavenly beings,<note: Or "than God"> and [with] glory and [with] majesty you crowned him.
passages.8:6: You make him over the works of your hands; all [things] you have placed under his feet:
passages.8:7: sheep and cattle, all of them, and also [the] wild animals of [the] field,
passages.8:8: [the] birds of [the] sky and the fish of the sea, [everything] that passes along the paths of seas.
passages.8:9: Yahweh, our Lord, how majestic [is] your name in all of the earth!
passages.9:title: For the [music] director, according to Muth-labben.<note: Meaning uncertain> A psalm of David.<note: The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by one>
passages.9:1: I will thank Yahweh with all my heart. I will tell of all your wonderful deeds.
passages.9:2: I will be glad and rejoice in you. I will sing [the praise of] your name, O Most High.
passages.9:3: When my enemies turn back, they will stumble and perish because of your presence.
passages.9:4: For you have maintained my just cause; you have sat on [the] throne judging correctly.
passages.9:5: You have rebuked [the] nations; you have destroyed [the] wicked. Their name you have blotted out forever and ever.
passages.9:6: The enemies are destroyed [in] ruins forever, and you have uprooted [their] cities; their very memory has perished.
passages.9:7: But Yahweh sits [enthroned] forever. He has established his throne for judgment.
passages.9:8: And he will judge [the] world with righteousness. He will judge [the] peoples with equity.
passages.9:9: And Yahweh will be a stronghold for the oppressed, a stronghold in times of distress.
passages.9:10: And those who know your name will trust in you, for you do not forsake those [who] seek you, O Yahweh.
passages.9:11: Sing [praises] to Yahweh [who] sits [enthroned]<note: Or "who dwells"> in Zion. Tell his deeds among the peoples,
passages.9:12: for he [who] {avenges bloodshed}<note: Literally "seeks bloods"> remembers them. He does not forget the distressed cry of [the] afflicted.
passages.9:13: Be gracious to me, O Yahweh. See my suffering from [those who] hate me, [you who] lift me up from the gates of death,
passages.9:14: so that I may tell of all your praises. In the gates of the daughter of Zion let me rejoice in your salvation.
passages.9:15: [The] nations have fallen in [the] pit [that] they made; their foot is caught in [the] net that they hid.
passages.9:16: Yahweh has made himself known; he has executed judgment. The wicked is snared by the work of his hands. Higgaion<note: Hebrew musical term> Selah
passages.9:17: [The] wicked shall turn back to Sheol, all [the] nations forgetting God,
passages.9:18: for [the] needy shall not always be forgotten; the hope of the poor shall never perish.
passages.9:19: Rise up, O Yahweh, let not humans<note: Hebrew "human"> prevail; let [the] nations be judged before you.
passages.9:20: O Yahweh, put them in fear. Let [the] nations know they [are merely] human. Selah
passages.10:1: Why, O Yahweh, do you stand far off? [Why] do you hide<note: Or "shut [your eyes]"> during times of distress?
passages.10:2: In arrogance [the] wicked persecutes<note: Or "pursues"> [the] poor. Let them be caught in [the] schemes that they devised,
passages.10:3: for [the] wicked boasts about the desire of his {heart},<note: Literally "soul"> and [the] one greedy for gain curses [and] treats Yahweh with contempt.
passages.10:4: {With bald-faced pride}<note: Literally "According to the height of his nose"> [the] wicked will not seek [God]. There is no God in any of his thoughts.
passages.10:5: His ways<note: According to the reading tradition (Qere)> endure at all times.<note: Hebrew "time"> Your judgments are aloof from him. [As for] all his enemies, he scoffs at them.
passages.10:6: He says in his heart, "I shall not be moved {throughout all generations},<note: Literally "for a generation and a generation"> [during] which [I will have] no trouble."
passages.10:7: His mouth is filled with cursing, with deceits and oppression; under his tongue are trouble and evil.
passages.10:8: He sits in ambush in villages; in the hiding places he kills [the] innocent. His eyes {lurk}<note: Literally "lie hid"> for [the] helpless.
passages.10:9: He lies in ambush {secretly,}<note: Literally "in the secret places"> like a lion in a thicket. He lies in ambush to seize [the] poor; he seizes [the] poor by catching him in his net.
passages.10:10: He is crushed;<note: Or "and he [the wicked] stoops"> he is bowed down;<note: Or "he [the wicked] crouches"> so<note: Or "and"> the helpless host<note: According to the reading tradition (Qere)> falls by his {might}.<note: Literally "mighty ones">
passages.10:11: He says in his heart, "God has forgotten. He has hidden his face. He never sees."
passages.10:12: Rise up, O Yahweh; O God, lift up your hand. Do not forget [the] afflicted.
passages.10:13: Why does the wicked treat God with contempt? He says in his heart, "You will not call [me] to account."
passages.10:14: [But] you have seen; indeed you have noted trouble and grief to take [it] into your hand. The helpless abandons [himself] upon you; you have been [the] helper [for the] orphan.
passages.10:15: Break [the] arm of [the] wicked, and [as for the] evil [man]-- seek out his wickedness [until] you find none.
passages.10:16: Yahweh [is] king forever and ever; the nations have perished from his land.
passages.10:17: [The] longing of [the] afflicted you have heard, O Yahweh. You will make their heart secure. You will {listen attentively}<note: Literally "cause your ear to hear">
passages.10:18: to render judgment [for the] fatherless and [the] oppressed [so that] a [mere] mortal from the earth will no longer cause terror.
passages.11:title: For the [music] director. Of David.<note: The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm>
passages.11:1: In Yahweh I have taken refuge; how can you say to my soul, "Flee to your mountain [like] a bird"?
passages.11:2: For look: The wicked {string the bow}.<note: Literally "tread the bow," that is, placing the foot on the bow to bend and string it> They have fitted their arrow to [the] string, to shoot from [the] darkness at the upright of heart.
passages.11:3: When the foundations are destroyed what can [the] righteous do?<note: Or "what has the righteous done">
passages.11:4: Yahweh [is] in his holy temple; Yahweh [is] in the heavens [on] his throne. His eyelids see; they test [the] children of humankind.
passages.11:5: Yahweh tests [the] righteous, but [the] wicked and [the] lover of violence his soul hates.
passages.11:6: He will rain coals<note: According to Symmachus (compare also Targum Psalms) a form slightly different from the MT's "snares"> on [the] wicked. Burning sulfur and scorching wind [will be] the portion of their cup.
passages.11:7: For Yahweh [is] righteous; he loves righteous deeds. [The] upright shall see his face.
passages.12:title: For the [music] director; on the Sheminith.<note: Meaning uncertain> A psalm of David.<note: The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by one>
passages.12:1: Save, O Yahweh, for [the] pious have ceased [to be]; for [the] faithful have vanished from [among the] children of humankind.
passages.12:2: They speak falseness {to each other}.<note: Literally "each with his companion"> [With] flattering lips, [with] {a double heart}<note: Literally "a heart and a heart"> they speak.
passages.12:3: May Yahweh cut off all flattering lips, [the] tongue speaking great boasts--
passages.12:4: [those] who say, "With our tongue we will prevail. Our lips [are] on our side. Who [is] master over us?"
passages.12:5: "Because of [the] oppression of [the] afflicted, because of [the] groaning of [the] poor, now I will rise up," Yahweh says. "I shall put [them] in [the] safety [for which] they<note: Hebrew "he"> long."
passages.12:6: The words of Yahweh [are] pure words [like] silver refined in the crucible on the ground, refined seven times.
passages.12:7: You, O Yahweh, will protect them. You will preserve him<note: Or "us"> from this generation always.
passages.12:8: [The] wicked prowl about when vileness [is] exalted among [the] children of humankind.
passages.13:title: For the [music] director. A psalm of David.<note: The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by one>
passages.13:1: How long, O Yahweh? Will you forget me forever? How long will you hide your face from me?
passages.13:2: How long must I take counsel<note: Hebrew pl.; with a slight modification of the Hebrew this reads "set pains"> in my soul, [and] sorrow in my heart [all the] day? How long will my enemy be exalted over me?
passages.13:3: Consider<note: Literally "Look"> [and] answer me, O Yahweh my God. Give light to my eyes lest I sleep [the sleep of] death,
passages.13:4: [and] lest my enemy should say, "I have overcome him," [lest] my enemies rejoice because I am shaken.
passages.13:5: But as for me, I have trusted in your steadfast love.<note: Or, "loyal love"> My heart will rejoice in your deliverance.
passages.13:6: <note: In the Hebrew Bible, the previous verse continues> I will sing to Yahweh because he has dealt bountifully with me.
passages.14:title: For the [music] director. Of David.<note: The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm>
passages.14:1: [The] fool says in his heart, "There is no God." They are corrupt. They do abominable deeds. There is none who does good.
passages.14:2: Yahweh looks down from heaven upon the children of humankind to see whether there is one who has insight, one who cares about God.
passages.14:3: All have gone astray; they are altogether corrupt. There is not one who does good; there is not even one.
passages.14:4: All who do evil--do they not know, [they] who eat my people [as though] they were eating bread? They do not call on Yahweh.
passages.14:5: There {they are very fearful}<note: Literally "they feared a fear"> because God [is] with [the] generation of [the] righteous.
passages.14:6: You would put to shame [the] plan of [the] poor, because<note: Or "but"> Yahweh [is] his refuge.
passages.14:7: {Oh that from Zion}<note: Literally "Who will give [that] from Zion"> [would come] salvation [for] Israel! When Yahweh returns the fortunes of his people, Jacob will rejoice; Israel will be happy.
passages.15:title: A psalm of David.<note: The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm>
passages.15:1: O Yahweh, who may reside in your tent? Who may dwell on your holy mountain?
passages.15:2: He who walks blamelessly and does what is right. He who speaks honestly in his heart.
passages.15:3: He does not slander with his tongue. He does not harm his friend, nor {bring up}<note: Literally "lift up"> a disgrace against his neighbor.
passages.15:4: In his eyes a rejected one [is] contemptible, but he honors those who respect Yahweh. He takes an oath to [his own] injury and does not retract it.
passages.15:5: He does not lend his money at interest, and does not take a bribe against [the] innocent. He who does these [things] will never be shaken.
passages.16:title: A miktam<note: Meaning uncertain> of David.<note: The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm>
passages.16:1: Protect me, O God, for I take refuge in you.
passages.16:2: [Oh my soul] you have said<note: Reading a feminine singular verb; some Hebrew manuscripts and translations read "I said"> to Yahweh, "You [are] my Lord. I have no good apart from you."
passages.16:3: With regard to [the] saints who [are] in the land, they [are the] noble ones in [whom is] all my desire.
passages.16:4: Those [who] hurry [after]<note: Or "they who acquire"> another [god] increase their sorrows. I will not pour out their drink offerings of blood, nor take up their names on my lips.
passages.16:5: Yahweh [is] the portion [which is] my share and my cup. You hold my lot.
passages.16:6: [The] measuring lines have fallen for me in pleasant places. Yes, [my] inheritance is delightful for me.
passages.16:7: I will bless Yahweh who advises me; yes, [at] night my {innermost being}<note: Literally "kidneys"> instructs me.
passages.16:8: I have set Yahweh before me always. Because [he is] at my right hand I will not be shaken.
passages.16:9: Therefore my heart is glad and my glory rejoices. Yes, my body will dwell in safety,
passages.16:10: for you will not abandon my soul to Sheol; you will not give your faithful one to see [the] grave.
passages.16:11: You will make known to me [the] path of life. In your presence [is] fullness of joy. At your right hand [are] pleasures forever.
passages.17:title: A prayer of David.<note: The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm>
passages.17:1: O Yahweh, hear a just cause. Hear my cry; heed my prayer [I make] without deceitful lips.
passages.17:2: Let my vindication come forth from you; let your eyes see fairness.
passages.17:3: You have tried my heart; you have examined [me] by night; you have tested me; you found nothing. I have decided [that] my mouth will not transgress.
passages.17:4: As for [the] works of humankind, by the word of your lips, I have kept [from] the ways of [the] violent.
passages.17:5: [I have] held my steps in your path My feet will not slip.
passages.17:6: As for me, I have called on you because you will answer me, O God. Incline your ear to me. Hear my words.<note: Hebrew "word">
passages.17:7: Show wondrously your acts of loyal love, O Savior of those who take refuge at your right hand<note: Or "saving by your right hand those"> from those who rise up against [them].
passages.17:8: Keep me as {the apple of your eye}.<note: Literally "[the] little man of the daughter of [your] eye"> Hide me in the shadow of your wings
passages.17:9: from [the] {presence}<note: Literally "face"> of [the] wicked who destroy me, [those] enemies against my life, [they that] surround me.
passages.17:10: They have shut off their calloused<note: Or "fat"> [heart]; [with] their mouth they speak arrogantly.
passages.17:11: Now they surround us at our [every] step. They {intend}<note: Literally "set their eyes"> {to pin}<note: Literally "to stretch"> [me] to the ground.
passages.17:12: {He is like}<note: Literally "His image"> a lion; he longs to tear apart, and like a strong lion crouching in hiding places.
passages.17:13: Rise up, O Yahweh, confront {him}.<note: Literally "his face"> Make him bow down. Rescue with your sword my life from [the] wicked,
passages.17:14: from men by your hand, O Yahweh, from men of [this] world. Their share [is] in {this life},<note: Literally "the life"> and you fill their stomach [with] your treasure. They are satisfied [with] children. They bequeath their excess to their children.
passages.17:15: [By contrast,] I in righteousness shall see your face. Upon awakening I will be satisfied [seeing] your form.
passages.18:title: For the [music] director. Of David, the servant of Yahweh, who spoke to Yahweh the words of this song {when}<note: Literally "on the day"> Yahweh delivered him from the hand of all his enemies, and from the hand of Saul.<note: The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by one>
passages.18:1: And he said: "I love you, O Yahweh, my strength."
passages.18:2: Yahweh [is] my rock and my fortress and my deliverer, my God, my rock in whom I have taken refuge, my shield and the horn of my deliverance, my stronghold.
passages.18:3: I called upon Yahweh, who is worthy to be praised, and I was saved from my enemies.
passages.18:4: The ropes of death encircled me, and streams of ruin overwhelmed me.
passages.18:5: The ropes of Sheol surrounded me; [the] snares of death confronted me.
passages.18:6: In my trouble I called on Yahweh, and to my God I cried for help. He heard my voice from his temple, and my cry for help came up before his presence into his ears.
passages.18:7: Then the earth shook and quaked, and [the] foundations of [the] mountains trembled, and they staggered because he was angry.
passages.18:8: Smoke went forth from his nose, and fire from his mouth consumed. Burning coals blazed from him.
passages.18:9: So he bowed [the] heavens and came down with a thick cloud under his feet.
passages.18:10: And he mounted a cherub and flew, and he swooped down on wings of wind.
passages.18:11: He made darkness his hiding place; all about him his covering [was] a darkness of waters, {thick clouds}.<note: Literally "clouds of clouds">
passages.18:12: From the brightness before him his clouds passed over [with] hail and coals of fire.
passages.18:13: And Yahweh thundered from the heavens, and the Most High uttered his voice [with] hail and coals of fire.
passages.18:14: And he shot his arrows and scattered them,<note: That is, the enemy> and many lightning bolts and routed them.
passages.18:15: Then the channels of [the] sea became visible, and [the] foundations of [the] world were uncovered by your rebuke, O Yahweh, by the {blast}<note: Or "breath"> of the wind of your nose.
passages.18:16: He reached<note: Or "sent"> from on high; he seized me. He drew me from many waters.
passages.18:17: He delivered me from my strong enemy, and from [those who] hated me because they were stronger than I.
passages.18:18: They confronted me on the day of disaster, but Yahweh was my support.
passages.18:19: So he brought me out to a spacious place. He delivered me because he delighted in me.
passages.18:20: Yahweh has rewarded me according to my righteousness; According to the cleanness of my hands he has repaid me.
passages.18:21: Because I have kept the ways of Yahweh, and have not acted wickedly against my God,
passages.18:22: because all his ordinances [are] before me, and his statutes I have not removed from me,
passages.18:23: and I was blameless before him, and I kept myself from my guilt.
passages.18:24: Therefore Yahweh has repaid me according to my righteousness, according to the cleanness of my hands in his sight.
passages.18:25: To [the] loyal you show yourself loyal. To [the] blameless you show yourself blameless.
passages.18:26: To [the] pure you show yourself pure. but to [the] wicked you show yourself shrewd.
passages.18:27: For you deliver humble people, but haughty eyes you humiliate.
passages.18:28: For you light my lamp; Yahweh, my God, lights up my darkness.
passages.18:29: For with you I can charge a troop, and with my God I can scale a wall.
passages.18:30: This<note: Hebrew "The"> God--his way [is] blameless. The word of Yahweh [is] flawless.<note: Or "refined"> He [is] a shield for all those who take refuge in him.
passages.18:31: For who [is] God apart from Yahweh, and who [is] a rock except our God?
passages.18:32: The God who girded me [with] strength, and made safe<note: Or "blameless"> my way,
passages.18:33: he made my feet like the deer's, and on my high places he makes me stand.
passages.18:34: [He] trains my hands for war, so that my arms can bend a bow of bronze.
passages.18:35: You also gave me the shield of your salvation, and your right hand supported me, and your humility made me great.
passages.18:36: You enlarged my step under me, and my ankles did not slip.
passages.18:37: I chased my enemies and overtook them; I did not turn back until they were finished [off].
passages.18:38: I struck them and they were not able to stand up; they fell under my feet.
passages.18:39: And you girded me [with] strength for the battle; [those] rising against me you made to kneel under me.
passages.18:40: And you {made my enemies turn their backs},<note: Literally "turned to me my enemies' neck"> then I destroyed those [who] hated me.
passages.18:41: They cried out but there was no rescuer, [even] to Yahweh, but he did not answer them.
passages.18:42: And I ground them like dust {in the wind},<note: Literally "on [the] face of [the] wind"> I emptied them<note: Many Hebrew manuscripts, the LXX, Syriac, and 2 Sam 22:43 read "I crushed them"> out like mud of [the] streets.
passages.18:43: You rescued me from strife with people; you set me as head (over) nations. People I did not know served me;
passages.18:44: as soon as {they heard},<note: Literally "hearing of ear"> they obeyed me. [The] children of a foreign land feigned obedience before me.
passages.18:45: [The] children of a foreign land {lost heart},<note: Literally "sunk down"> and they came trembling from their strongholds.
passages.18:46: Yahweh lives, and blessed [be] my rock, and may the God of my salvation be exalted--
passages.18:47: the God who executed vengeance for me, and subdued peoples under me,
passages.18:48: who delivered me from my enemies. Indeed, you exalted me higher than [those who] rose against me. You delivered me from the man of violence.
passages.18:49: Therefore I will give thanks to you among the nations, O Yahweh, and I will sing [the praise] of your name:
passages.18:50: the one who makes great victories for his king, and [who] shows loyal love for his anointed, to David and to his descendants forever.
passages.19:title: For the [music] director. A psalm of David.<note: The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by one>
passages.19:1: The heavens [are] telling the glory of God, and the firmament proclaims the work of his hands.
passages.19:2: {Every day}<note: Literally "day to day"> [they] pour forth speech, and {every night}<note: Literally "night to night"> [they] tell knowledge.
passages.19:3: There is no speech and there are no words; their sound is inaudible.
passages.19:4: [Yet] in all [the] world their line<note: LXX "line"> goes out, and their words to [the] end of [the] world. In them<note: That is, the heavens> he has pitched a tent for the sun,
passages.19:5: and it [is] like a bridegroom who comes out of his bridal chamber. It is glad like a strong man to run [its] course.
passages.19:6: Its rising [is] from [one]<note: Hebrew "the"> end of the heavens and its circuit to the [other] end<note: Hebrew "ends"> of them; and nothing [is] hidden from its heat.
passages.19:7: The law of Yahweh [is] perfect, reviving life.<note: Or "soul"> The testimony of Yahweh [is] firm, making wise [the] simple.
passages.19:8: The precepts of Yahweh [are] right, making [the] heart rejoice. The command of Yahweh [is] pure, enlightening [the] eyes.
passages.19:9: The fear of Yahweh [is] pure, enduring forever. The ordinances of Yahweh [are] true; they are righteous altogether,
passages.19:10: more desirable than gold, even much fine gold; and sweeter than honey, even honey [in the] comb.
passages.19:11: Moreover, your servant [is] warned<note: Or "illumined"> by them; in keeping them [is] great reward.
passages.19:12: Who can perceive [his] errors? Acquit me from hidden [faults].
passages.19:13: Also, keep back your servant from arrogant [sins];<note: Usage elsewhere might suggest "arrogant people"> let them not rule over me. Then I shall be blameless, and I shall be innocent of great transgression.
passages.19:14: Let the words of my mouth and the meditation of my heart be acceptable in your presence, O Yahweh, my rock and my redeemer.
passages.20:title: For the [music] director. A psalm of David.<note: The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by one>
passages.20:1: May Yahweh answer you in [the] day of trouble. May the name of Jacob's God protect<note: The sense is that of making something inaccessibly high, like a fortress> you.
passages.20:2: May he send you help<note: Hebrew "your help"> from [the] sanctuary, and from Zion may he sustain you.
passages.20:3: May he remember all your offerings, and your burnt offering may he {regard favorably}.<note: Literally "find [to be] fat">
passages.20:4: May he give to you {your heart's desire},<note: Literally "according to your heart"> and your every plan may he fulfill. Selah
passages.20:5: May we shout for joy over your victory, and in the name of our God may we set up banners. May Yahweh fulfill all your requests.
passages.20:6: Now I know that Yahweh will help his anointed.<note: Hebrew "messiah"> He will answer him from his holy heaven with the victorious power of his right hand.
passages.20:7: {Some boast in chariots and others in horses},<note: Literally "These in the chariots and those in the horses"> but we boast in the name of Yahweh, our God.
passages.20:8: They will collapse and fall, and we will rise and stand firm.
passages.20:9: Rescue,<note: Or "Grant victory"> O Yahweh. Let the king answer us when we call.
passages.21:title: For the [music] director. A psalm of David.<note: The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by one>
passages.21:1: O Yahweh, [the] king will rejoice in your strength, and how greatly he will delight in your help.<note: Or "victory">
passages.21:2: You have given him the desire of his heart, and have not withheld the request of his lips. Selah
passages.21:3: For you meet him [with] blessings of good [things]. You set on his head a crown of fine gold.
passages.21:4: He asked life from you; you gave [it] to him-- length of days forever and ever.
passages.21:5: His honor [is] great because of your help.<note: Or "victory"> Splendor and majesty you have bestowed upon him.
passages.21:6: For you set [on] him blessings forever. You make him glad with [the] joy [of] your presence.
passages.21:7: Because the king trusts Yahweh, and through the steadfast love<note: Or "loyal love"> of the Most High he shall not be moved.
passages.21:8: Your hand will find all your enemies; your right hand will find those who hate you.
passages.21:9: You will make them like your fiery furnace at the time of your appearance. Yahweh will swallow them in his wrath and fire will consume them.
passages.21:10: You will destroy their {offspring}<note: Literally "fruit"> from [the] earth, and their {descendants}<note: Literally "seed"> from among [the] children of humankind.
passages.21:11: Though they have {plotted}<note: Literally "spread out"> evil against you, [though] they have planned a scheme, they will not prevail.
passages.21:12: For you will {turn them to flight};<note: Literally "make them a shoulder"> you will aim [arrows] on your bowstrings at their faces.
passages.21:13: Be exalted, O Yahweh, in your strength, and we sing and praise your power.
passages.22:title: For the [music] director; according to The Doe of the Dawn. A psalm of David.<note: The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by one>
passages.22:1: My God, my God why have you forsaken me? [Why are you] far from helping me, [far from] the words of my groaning?
passages.22:2: O my God, I call by day and you do not answer, and [by] night but I have no rest.<note: Or "I am not silent">
passages.22:3: Yet you [are] holy, enthroned on the praises of Israel.
passages.22:4: Our ancestors<note: Or "fathers"> trusted you; they trusted and you delivered them.
passages.22:5: They cried to you and were saved; they trusted you and were not ashamed.
passages.22:6: But I [am] a worm and not a man, scorned by humankind and despised by people.
passages.22:7: All [who] see me mock me. They open wide [their] lips; they shake [the] head, [saying]:
passages.22:8: "{He trusts Yahweh}.<note: Literally "Commit to Yahweh"> Let him rescue him. Let him deliver him because he delights in him."
passages.22:9: Yet [you] took me from [the] belly; you made me trust [while] on my mother's breasts.
passages.22:10: On you I was cast from [the] womb. From my mother's belly you [have been] my God.
passages.22:11: Do not be far from me because trouble [is] near; because there is no helper.
passages.22:12: Many bulls have encircled me; mighty [bulls] of Bashan have surrounded me.
passages.22:13: They open their mouth against me [like] a lion tearing and roaring.
passages.22:14: I am poured out like water, and all my bones are out of joint. My heart is like wax; it is melted {within me}.<note: Literally "in the midst of my intestines">
passages.22:15: My strength is dry like a potsherd, and my tongue is sticking [to] my jaws; and you have placed me in [the] dust of death.
passages.22:16: Because dogs have surrounded me; a gang of evildoers has encircled me. Like the lion<note: Or "they gouge out" or "they bind." Not the same word for "lion" found in vv. 14(13), 22(21). The Hebrew text presents such problems that any interpretation must be lightly held.> [they are at] my hands and my feet.
passages.22:17: I can count all my bones; they gaze, they look at me.
passages.22:18: They divide my garments among them, and for my clothing they cast lots.<note: Hebrew "lot">
passages.22:19: But you, O Yahweh, do not remain distant. O my help, hasten to help me.
passages.22:20: Rescue my life from [the] sword, my only [life] from [the] power of [the] dogs.<note: Hebrew "dog">
passages.22:21: Save me from [the] mouth of [the] lion, and from [the] horns of [the] wild oxen answer me.
passages.22:22: I will tell your name to my brothers; inside [the] assembly I will praise you.
passages.22:23: You who revere Yahweh, praise him! Glorify him, all [you] seed of Jacob, and be in awe of him, all [you] seed of Israel,
passages.22:24: because he has not despised nor abhorred [the] affliction of [the] afflicted, and has not hid his face from him; but he listened to him when he cried for help.
passages.22:25: From you [is] my praise. In [the] great assembly, I will pay my vows before those who revere him.
passages.22:26: [The] afflicted will eat and will be satisfied. Those who seek him will praise Yahweh. May your<note: Plural> heart live forever.
passages.22:27: All [the] ends of [the] earth will remember and turn to Yahweh. All [the] families of [the] nations will worship before you.
passages.22:28: Because the kingship belongs to Yahweh, and [he] rules over the nations.
passages.22:29: All [the] {healthy ones}<note: Or "prosperous"; Literally "fat ones"> of [the] earth will eat and worship. Before him all [of] those descending [into the] dust will kneel, even he [who] cannot keep his soul alive.
passages.22:30: Descendants<note: Hebrew "Descendant"> will serve him. Regarding the Lord, it will be told to the [next] generation.
passages.22:31: They will come and tell his saving<note: Or "righteousness"> [deeds] to a people [yet] to be born, that he has done [it].
passages.23:title: A psalm of David.<note: The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm>
passages.23:1: Yahweh is my shepherd; I will not lack [for anything].
passages.23:2: In grassy pastures he makes me lie down; by quiet waters he leads me.
passages.23:3: He restores my life.<note: Or "my soul"> He leads me in {correct paths}<note: Literally "paths of righteousness"> for the sake of his name.
passages.23:4: Even when I walk in a dark valley, I fear no evil because you [are] with me. Your rod and your staff, they comfort me.
passages.23:5: You prepare before me a table in the presence of my oppressors. You anoint my head with oil; my cup [is] overflowing.
passages.23:6: Surely goodness and loyal love will pursue me all the days of my life, and I will stay<note: Hebrew "return"> in the house<note: Or "temple"> of Yahweh {for a very long time}.<note: Literally "for length of days">
passages.24:title: A psalm of David.<note: The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm>
passages.24:1: The earth is Yahweh's, with its fullness, [the] world and those who live in it,
passages.24:2: because he has founded it on [the] seas, and has established it on [the] rivers.
passages.24:3: Who may ascend [the] mountain of Yahweh? And who may stand in his holy place?
passages.24:4: He who is innocent of hands and pure of heart, who does not lift up his soul to falseness, and does not swear deceitfully.
passages.24:5: He will receive blessing from Yahweh, and justice<note: Or "vindication"> from the God of his salvation.
passages.24:6: Such [is the] sort of those who seek<note: According to the reading tradition (Qere)> him, those who seek your face, even Jacob. Selah
passages.24:7: Lift up your heads, O gates, and rise up, O ancient doorways, that the king of glory<note: Literally "the king of the glory"> may enter.
passages.24:8: Who [is] the king of glory?<note: Literally "the king of the glory"> Yahweh, strong and mighty; Yahweh, mighty in war!
passages.24:9: Lift up your heads, O gates, and lift up, O ancient doorways, that the king of glory<note: Literally "the king of the glory"> may enter.
passages.24:10: Who is the king of glory?<note: Literally "the king of the glory"> Yahweh of hosts, He [is] the king of glory!<note: Literally "the king of the glory"> Selah
passages.25:title: Of David.<note: The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm>
passages.25:1: To you, O Yahweh, I lift up my soul.
passages.25:2: O my God, I trust you; let me not be put to shame. Do not let my enemies exult over me.
passages.25:3: Indeed, none who wait for you should be put to shame. Those who betray without cause should be put to shame.
passages.25:4: Make me know your ways, O Yahweh. Teach me your paths.
passages.25:5: Cause me to walk in your truth and teach me, because you [are] the God of my salvation. I await you {all day long}.<note: Literally "all of the day">
passages.25:6: Remember your compassion, O Yahweh, and your acts of loyal love, because they [are] from of old.
passages.25:7: Do not remember the sins of my youth or my transgressions. According to your loyal love remember me [if] you [will], for the sake of your goodness, O Yahweh.
passages.25:8: Good and right [is] Yahweh; therefore he instructs sinners in the way.
passages.25:9: He causes [the] humble to walk in justice, and teaches [the] humble his way.
passages.25:10: All the paths of Yahweh [are] loyal love and faithfulness for those who keep his covenant and statutes.<note: Or "covenant statutes">
passages.25:11: Also, for the sake of your name, O Yahweh, forgive my sin, because it [is] great.
passages.25:12: Who [is] the man fearing Yahweh? He will instruct him in [the] way he should choose.
passages.25:13: His soul will lodge in prosperity, and his offspring will possess [the] land.
passages.25:14: Intimate fellowship with Yahweh [is] for those who fear him, and [he] makes known his covenant to them.
passages.25:15: My eyes [are] continually toward Yahweh, because he will take my feet from [the] net.
passages.25:16: Turn to me and have mercy on me because I [am] lonely and afflicted.
passages.25:17: Remove the troubles of my heart; bring me out from my distresses.
passages.25:18: Consider my affliction and trouble, and forgive<note: Or "take away"> all my sins.
passages.25:19: Consider that my enemies are many, and they hate me [with] violent hatred.
passages.25:20: Protect my life and deliver me. Let me not be put to shame, because I take shelter in you.
passages.25:21: Let integrity and uprightness preserve me, because I wait for you.
passages.25:22: O God, redeem Israel from all its troubles.
passages.26:title: Of David.<note: The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm>
passages.26:1: Judge me, O Yahweh, because I have walked in my integrity, and I have trusted Yahweh and not wavered.
passages.26:2: Prove me, O Yahweh, and test me. Try my {innermost being}<note: Literally "kidneys," the locus of intense thoughts and emotions in biblical Hebrew> and my {mind}.<note: Literally "heart">
passages.26:3: Because your loyal love [is] before my eyes, and I walk about in your faithfulness.
passages.26:4: I do not sit with deceitful people, nor will I go about with hypocrites.
passages.26:5: I hate [the] crowd of evildoers, and with [the] wicked I will not sit.
passages.26:6: I will wash my hands in innocence, and I will walk about your altar, O Yahweh,
passages.26:7: to declare with a voice of thanksgiving, and tell of all your wondrous deeds.
passages.26:8: O Yahweh, I love [the] dwelling of your house,<note: Or "temple"> and {the place where your glory abides}.<note: Literally "the place of the dwelling place of your glory">
passages.26:9: Do not destroy me<note: Or "gather my soul [for judgment]"> with [the] sinners, nor my life with men of bloodshed,
passages.26:10: in whose hands [is] an evil plan, and whose right hand is full of bribes.<note: Hebrew "bribe">
passages.26:11: But as for me, I will walk in my integrity. Redeem me and be gracious to me.
passages.26:12: My foot stands on level ground. In assemblies I will bless Yahweh.
passages.27:title: Of David.<note: The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm>
passages.27:1: Yahweh [is] my light and my salvation; whom shall I fear? Yahweh [is] the refuge of my life; of whom shall I be afraid?
passages.27:2: When evildoers drew near against me to eat my flesh-- my adversaries and my enemies [who drew near] to me-- they themselves stumbled and fell.
passages.27:3: Though an army encamp against me, my heart will not fear. Though war arise against me, [even] in this I [will] remain confident.
passages.27:4: One [thing] I have asked from Yahweh; it I will seek: [that] I may dwell in the house<note: Or "temple"> of Yahweh all the days of my life, to behold the beauty of Yahweh, and to consider<note: Or "inquire in"> his temple.
passages.27:5: Because he will hide me in his shelter in [the] day of trouble. He will conceal me in the hiding place of his tent. He will set me high upon a rock.
passages.27:6: And now my head will be high over my enemies round about me. And I will offer in his tent sacrifices with shouts of joy. I will sing, yes, I will sing praises to Yahweh.
passages.27:7: Hear, O Yahweh, my voice [when] I call, and be gracious to me and answer me.
passages.27:8: On your behalf my heart says, "Seek my face." Your face, O Yahweh, I do seek.
passages.27:9: Do not hide your face from me; do not turn your servant away in anger. You have been my help; do not abandon nor forsake me, O God of my salvation.
passages.27:10: If my father or my mother forsake me, then Yahweh will receive me.
passages.27:11: Teach me, O Yahweh, your way, and lead me on a level path because of my enemies.
passages.27:12: Do not give me over to the desire of my enemies, because false witnesses have arisen against me, and [each] breathing out violence.<note: Or "and [each] a witness of violence">
passages.27:13: Surely<note: Hebrew text is uncertain> I believe [that I will] see the goodness of Yahweh in [the] land of [the] living.
passages.27:14: Wait for Yahweh. Be strong and let your heart show strength, and wait for Yahweh.
passages.28:title: A psalm of David.<note: The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm>
passages.28:1: To you, O Yahweh, I call. O my rock, do not be deaf to me. Or else, if you are silent to me, then I will become like those descending to [the] pit.
passages.28:2: Hear the voice of my supplications when I cry to you for help, when I lift up my hands toward your holy inner sanctuary.
passages.28:3: Do not drag me away with [the] wicked or with [the] workers of evil, [who] speak of peace with their neighbors, while evil [is] in their heart.
passages.28:4: Give to them according to their work, even according to the evil of their deeds. Give to them according to the work of their hands; repay them their rightful due.
passages.28:5: Because they do not regard the works of Yahweh, nor the work of his hands, he will destroy them and not rebuild them.
passages.28:6: Blessed [is] Yahweh, because he has heard the voice of my supplications.
passages.28:7: Yahweh [is] my strength and my shield. My heart trusts him and I am helped. So my heart rejoices, and with my song I will give thanks to him.
passages.28:8: Yahweh [is] their strength, and he [is] the refuge for the salvation of his anointed one.
passages.28:9: Save your people and bless your heritage. Shepherd them also and carry them always.
passages.29:title: A psalm of David.<note: The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm>
passages.29:1: Ascribe to Yahweh, O sons of God,<note: Or "heavenly beings"> ascribe to Yahweh glory and strength.
passages.29:2: Ascribe to Yahweh the glory {due}<note: Literally "of"> his name. Worship Yahweh in holy array.
passages.29:3: The voice of Yahweh [is] over the waters; the God of glory thunders. Yahweh [is] over many waters.
passages.29:4: The voice of Yahweh [is] powerful. The voice of Yahweh [is] majestic.
passages.29:5: The voice of Yahweh breaks [the] cedars. Yahweh shatters even the cedars of Lebanon.
passages.29:6: And he makes them skip like a calf; Lebanon and Sirion like a young wild ox.
passages.29:7: The voice of Yahweh flashes<note: Or "divides"> flames of fire.
passages.29:8: The voice of Yahweh shakes [the] wilderness. Yahweh shakes the wilderness of Kadesh.
passages.29:9: The voice of Yahweh causes deer<note: A slightly different Hebrew word here yields, "makes the oaks tremble"> to give birth and strips [the] forests bare. And at his temple all in it say, "Glory!"
passages.29:10: Yahweh sits [enthroned] at the flood, and Yahweh sits [as] king forever.
passages.29:11: May Yahweh give strength to his people. May Yahweh bless his people with peace.
passages.30:title: A psalm; a song for the dedication of the house.<note: Or "temple"> Of David.<note: The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by one>
passages.30:1: I will exalt you, O Yahweh, because you have drawn me up, and have not made my enemies rejoice over me.
passages.30:2: O Yahweh, my God, I cried for help to you, and you healed me.
passages.30:3: O Yahweh, you have brought my life up from Sheol. You preserved me alive from among those going down <note: According to the Kethib; the reading tradition (Qere) reads "so I would not go down"> to [the] pit.
passages.30:4: Sing praises to Yahweh, you his faithful ones, and give thanks {to his holy fame}.<note: Literally "to the fame of his holiness">
passages.30:5: For [there is] a moment in his anger; [there is] a lifetime in his favor. Weeping lodges for the evening, but in the morning [comes] rejoicing.
passages.30:6: But as for me, I had said in my prosperity, "I shall not be moved ever."
passages.30:7: O Yahweh, by your favor you caused my strong mountain to stand. You hid your face. I was bewildered.
passages.30:8: To you, O Yahweh, I called, and to the Lord I pleaded for grace [saying],
passages.30:9: "What gain [is there] in my {death},<note: Literally "blood"> in my going down into [the] pit? Will [the] dust praise you? Will it tell of your faithfulness?
passages.30:10: "O Yahweh, hear and be gracious to me. O Yahweh, be my helper."
passages.30:11: You have turned my wailing into my dancing. You have removed my sackcloth and clothed me [with] joy
passages.30:12: so that {I}<note: Literally "my glory"> may sing praises to you and not be quiet. O Yahweh, my God, I will give thanks to you forever.
passages.31:title: For the [music] director. A psalm of David.<note: The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by one>
passages.31:1: In you, O Yahweh, I have taken refuge. Let me not be put to shame ever. Deliver me by your righteousness.
passages.31:2: Incline your ear to me. Quickly deliver me. Become my rock of refuge, {a fortified keep}<note: Literally "a house of strongholds"> to save me.
passages.31:3: For you [are] my rock and my fortress. So, for the sake of your name, lead me and guide me.
passages.31:4: Bring me out of [the] net that they have secretly set for me, for you [are] my refuge.
passages.31:5: Into your hand I commit my spirit. You have redeemed me, O Yahweh, faithful God.<note: Or "God of truth">
passages.31:6: I hate those devoted to useless idols, but I trust Yahweh.
passages.31:7: I will exult and rejoice in your loyal love. Because you have seen my misery, you know the distresses of my life.<note: Or "soul">
passages.31:8: And you have not delivered me into [the] hand of [the] enemy. You have set my feet in a broad place.
passages.31:9: Be gracious [to] me, O Yahweh, because I have distress. My eye wastes away because of vexation, [along with] my soul and my {body}.<note: Literally "belly">
passages.31:10: For my life is at an end with sorrow, and my years with sighing. My strength stumbles because of my iniquity, and my bones waste away.
passages.31:11: Because of all my adversaries I have become a disgrace, especially to my neighbors, and a dread to my acquaintances. [Those who] see me in the street flee from me.
passages.31:12: I have become forgotten like [one] dead, out of {mind}.<note: Literally "heart"> I am like a destroyed vessel.
passages.31:13: For I hear [the] rumor of many, "Terror on every side!" When conspiring together against me, they have plotted to take my life.
passages.31:14: But as for me, I trust you, O Yahweh. I say, "You [are] my God."
passages.31:15: My times<note: Or "destiny"> [are] in your hand. Deliver me from the hand of my enemies and from [those who] pursue me.
passages.31:16: Shine your face upon your servant. Save me by your loyal love.
passages.31:17: O Yahweh, let me not be put to shame, for I call on you. Let the wicked be put to shame. Let them [go] silently<note: Or "let them [with] wailing [enter]"> to Sheol.
passages.31:18: Let lying lips be dumb, that speak against [the] righteous<note: Or "the innocent one"> unrestrained with arrogance and contempt.
passages.31:19: How abundant [is] your goodness that you have stored up for [those who] fear you, that you perform for those who take refuge in you before [the] children of humankind.
passages.31:20: You will hide them in the protection of your presence from [the] plots of man. You will hide them in a shelter from [the] strife of tongues.
passages.31:21: Blessed [is] Yahweh, because he has worked marvelously his loyal love to me in a besieged city.
passages.31:22: As for me, I said in my alarm, "I am cut off from before your eyes." However you heard the voice of my supplications when I cried to you for help.
passages.31:23: Love Yahweh, all you his faithful ones. Yahweh preserves [the] faithful but repays abundantly [the] one who acts arrogantly.
passages.31:24: Be strong and let your<note: Plural> heart show strength, all [you] who wait for Yahweh.
passages.32:title: Of David. A maskil.<note: The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm>
passages.32:1: Happy [is] he whose transgression is taken away, whose sin is covered.
passages.32:2: Happy [is] a person to whom Yahweh does not impute iniquity and in whose spirit there is not deceit.
passages.32:3: When I kept silent, my bones were worn out due to my groaning all the day.
passages.32:4: For day and night your hand was heavy upon me. My vigor was changed into [the] dry heat of summer. Selah
passages.32:5: I made known my sin to you, and my iniquity I did not cover. I said, "I will confess concerning my transgressions to Yahweh," and you took away the guilt of my sin. Selah
passages.32:6: Therefore let all [the] faithful pray to you at [the] time [for] finding [you]. Surely at [the] flood of many waters they will not reach him.
passages.32:7: You [are] my hiding place; from trouble you preserve me. [With] cries of deliverance you surround me. Selah
passages.32:8: I<note: Yahweh is speaking in vv. 8-9> will instruct you and teach you in [the] way that you should go. I will advise [you] [with] my eye upon you.
passages.32:9: Do not be like a horse [or] like a mule, without understanding; [that needs] his tackle--bridle and rein--for restraint [or he would not] come near you.
passages.32:10: Many are [the] pains of the wicked, but [for] the one who trusts Yahweh loyal love surrounds him.
passages.32:11: Be glad in Yahweh and rejoice, [you] righteous, and shout for joy, all [you] upright of heart.
passages.33:1: Exult in Yahweh, O [you] righteous, [for] praise [is] fitting for the upright.
passages.33:2: Give thanks to Yahweh with [the] lyre; with a harp of ten strings play to him.
passages.33:3: Sing to him a new song; play skillfully with jubilant shout.
passages.33:4: For the word of Yahweh [is] upright, and all his work [is done] in faithfulness.
passages.33:5: [He] loves righteousness and justice. The earth is full of the loyal love of Yahweh.
passages.33:6: By the word of Yahweh [the] heavens were made, and by the breath of his mouth all their host.
passages.33:7: [He] gathered the waters of the sea like a heap. [He] put [the] deeps in storehouses.
passages.33:8: Let all the earth fear Yahweh. Let all [the] inhabitants of [the] world stand in awe of him.
passages.33:9: For {he himself spoke}<note: Literally "he, he spoke"> and it came to pass. {He himself commanded}<note: Literally "He, he commanded"> and it stood firm.
passages.33:10: Yahweh brings to nothing<note: Or "breaks"> [the] plan of nations; he frustrates<note: Or "nullifies"> [the] intents of peoples.
passages.33:11: The plan of Yahweh stands firm forever, the intents of his heart {from one generation to the next}.<note: Literally "to a generation and a generation">
passages.33:12: Blessed [is] the nation whose God [is] Yahweh, the people he has chosen for his inheritance.
passages.33:13: From heaven Yahweh looks; he sees all the children of humankind.
passages.33:14: From his dwelling place<note: Or "the place where he sits enthroned"> he gazes on all the inhabitants of the earth,
passages.33:15: he who fashions altogether their heart, he who understands all their works.
passages.33:16: The king [is] not saved by [the] greatness of an army. The warrior is not delivered by [the] greatness of strength.
passages.33:17: The horse [is] a false hope for victory, nor can it save by the greatness of its power.
passages.33:18: Behold, the eye of Yahweh [is] on those who fear him, on those who hope<note: Or "wait expectantly"> for his loyal love
passages.33:19: to deliver their soul from death and to keep them alive in famine.
passages.33:20: Our soul waits for Yahweh; he [is] our help and our shield.
passages.33:21: For in him our heart rejoices because in his holy name we trust.
passages.33:22: Let your loyal love, O Yahweh, be upon us, {even as}<note: Literally "as which"> we hope in you.
passages.34:title: Of David, when he {pretended to be crazy}<note: Literally "he changed his discernment"> in front of Abimelech<note: Literally "my father is king" whereas 1 Sam 21:10(9) has "Achish." "Abimelech" is perhaps an honorific title, since its literal meaning suggests a legitimate right to rule> so that he drove him out, and [so] he departed.<note: The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by one>
passages.34:1: I will bless Yahweh at all times; his praise [shall be] in my mouth continually.
passages.34:2: My soul makes its boast in Yahweh; let the humble hear and be glad.
passages.34:3: Magnify Yahweh with me, and let us exalt his name together.
passages.34:4: I sought Yahweh and he answered me, and from all my terrors he delivered me.
passages.34:5: They looked to him and were radiant, and their faces shall not be ashamed.<note: Or "and let not their faces be ashamed">
passages.34:6: This poor [man] called and Yahweh heard, and saved him from all his troubles.
passages.34:7: The angel of Yahweh encamps around [those who] fear him, and he rescues them.
passages.34:8: Taste and see that Yahweh [is] good; blessed [is] the man [who] takes refuge in him.
passages.34:9: Fear Yahweh, [you] his saints,<note: Or "holy ones"> for there is no lack for [those who] fear him.
passages.34:10: [The] young lions are in want and suffer hunger, but those who seek Yahweh will not lack for any good thing.
passages.34:11: Come, [you] children, listen to me; I will teach you the fear of Yahweh.
passages.34:12: Who [is] the man who desires life, who loves [many] days in order to see good?
passages.34:13: Keep your tongue from evil and your lips from speaking deceit.
passages.34:14: Turn from evil and do good. Seek peace and pursue it.
passages.34:15: The eyes of Yahweh [are] toward [the] righteous, and his ears toward their cry for help.
passages.34:16: The face of Yahweh [is] against evildoers, to cut off the remembrance of them from [the] earth.
passages.34:17: They<note: That is, the righteous> cry out and Yahweh hears and delivers them from all [of] their troubles.
passages.34:18: Yahweh [is] near to [those who are] heartbroken and saves [those who are] crushed in spirit.
passages.34:19: Many [are the] distresses of [the] righteous, but Yahweh delivers him out of them all.
passages.34:20: [He] protects all his bones; not one of them is broken.
passages.34:21: Evil will slay [the] wicked, and [those who] hate [the] righteous will incur guilt.
passages.34:22: Yahweh redeems the life of his servants, and none who take refuge in him will incur guilt.
passages.35:title: Of David.<note: The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm>
passages.35:1: Contend, O Yahweh, with my contenders; fight [those who] fight me.
passages.35:2: Grasp buckler and shield and rise to my aid.
passages.35:3: And draw [the] spear and javelin to meet [those who] pursue me. Say to my soul, "I [am] your salvation."
passages.35:4: Let those who seek my life be shamed and humiliated. Let those who plot calamity against me be repulsed and ashamed.
passages.35:5: Let them be like chaff before [the] wind, with the angel of Yahweh {driving them}.<note: Literally "pushing">
passages.35:6: Let their way be dark and slippery, with the angel of Yahweh pursuing them.
passages.35:7: For without cause they secretly hide the pit with their net for me; without cause they dug [it] for my life.
passages.35:8: Let {unforeseen ruin}<note: Literally "ruin he does not know"> come on him, and his net that he hid, let it catch him. Let him fall into it in ruin.
passages.35:9: Then my soul will rejoice in Yahweh; it will rejoice in his salvation.
passages.35:10: All of my bones shall say, "O Yahweh, who [is] like you, who delivers [the] poor from [one] stronger than he and [the] poor and needy from [the one who] robs him?"
passages.35:11: Violent witnesses rise up; they ask me [concerning] what I do not know.
passages.35:12: They repay me evil in place of good. [It is] bereavement to my soul.
passages.35:13: But as for me, when they were sick, my clothing [was] sackcloth. I weakened my soul with fasting, and my prayer {returned to me unanswered}.<note: Literally "upon my lap it will return">
passages.35:14: I {behaved}<note: Literally "walked about"> as [though he were] a friend [or] as a brother to me. As one lamenting a mother, I was bowed down [in] mourning.
passages.35:15: But at my stumbling they rejoiced and gathered together; smiters whom I did not know gathered against me. They tore and did not cease.
passages.35:16: Among [the] ungodly of the mockers at feasts,<note: With a slight change the Hebrew might read, "The ungodly boldly mocked"> [they] gnashed at me with their teeth.
passages.35:17: My Lord, how long will you watch? Restore my life from their ravages,<note: Or "roaring"> my only [life] from [the] young lions.
passages.35:18: I will give thanks [to] you in [the] great assembly; among [the] mighty people I will praise you.
passages.35:19: Let not those who [are] wrongfully my enemies<note: Or "those who oppose me [with] falsehood"> rejoice over me. [Nor let] those who hate me without cause wink [the] eye.
passages.35:20: For they do not speak peace, but against [the] quiet [ones] of [the] land they plan deceitful words.
passages.35:21: They also made wide their mouths<note: Hebrew "mouth"> against me. They said, "Aha! Aha! Our eyes have seen [it]."
passages.35:22: You have seen, O Yahweh. Do not be deaf. O Lord, do not be far from me.
passages.35:23: Wake up and rouse yourself for my right, for my cause, O my God and my Lord.
passages.35:24: Vindicate me according to your righteousness, O Yahweh my God, and do not let them rejoice over me.
passages.35:25: Do not let them say in their hearts,<note: Hebrew "heart"> "Aha, our desire." Let them not say, "We have swallowed him up."
passages.35:26: Let them be shamed and abashed altogether, who rejoice at my misfortune. Let them put on shame and insult, who magnify themselves against me.
passages.35:27: Let them shout for joy and be glad, who delight in my vindication; and let them say continually, "Yahweh is great, who delights in the welfare of his servant."
passages.35:28: Then my tongue will proclaim your righteousness, [and] your praise all day.
passages.36:title: For the [music] director. Of David, the servant of Yahweh.<note: The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by one>
passages.36:1: An oracle: the wicked has rebellion in the midst of his<note: Reading with a few Hebrew manuscripts and some versions; MT reads "my"> heart. There is no fear of God before his eyes.
passages.36:2: For he flatters himself in his eyes, hating to detect his iniquity.<note: Or "when finding his iniquity and when hating">
passages.36:3: The words of his mouth [are] wickedness and deceit. He has ceased to have insight [and] to do good.
passages.36:4: He plans sin on his bed. He puts himself on a way [that is] not good. He does not reject evil.
passages.36:5: O Yahweh, your loyal love [extends] into [the] heavens, your faithfulness unto [the] clouds.
passages.36:6: Your righteousness [is] {like the mighty mountains},<note: Literally "like the mountains of God"> your judgments [like the] great deep. You save man and beast, O Yahweh.
passages.36:7: How precious [is] your loyal love, O God, and the children of humankind take refuge in the shadow of your wings.
passages.36:8: They are refreshed with the {fullness}<note: Literally "fatness"> of your house,<note: Or "temple"> and you give them drink [from] the river of your delights.
passages.36:9: For with you is [the] fountain of life; in your light we see light.
passages.36:10: Prolong your loyal love to those who know you, and your righteousness to [the] upright of heart.
passages.36:11: Do not let a foot of pride come against me, nor let a wicked hand make me to wander homeless.
passages.36:12: There doers of evil have fallen; they are thrust down and not able to rise.
passages.37:title: Of David.<note: The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm>
passages.37:1: Do not fret because of evildoers; do not be envious of doers of wickedness.
passages.37:2: For like the grass they will dry up quickly, and like green vegetation they will wither.
passages.37:3: Trust Yahweh and do good. Abide [in the] land and feed on faithfulness.<note: That is, God's faithfulness>
passages.37:4: Take pleasure in Yahweh as well, and he will give to you the requests of your heart.
passages.37:5: {Commit to}<note: Literally "Roll upon"> Yahweh your way; Trust also on him and he will act.
passages.37:6: Then he will bring forth your righteousness like the light, and your justice like the noonday.
passages.37:7: Be quiet before Yahweh and wait for him. Do not fret about one who succeeds [in] his way, about a man making plots.
passages.37:8: Refrain from anger and forsake wrath. Do not fret; [it] only brings evil.
passages.37:9: For evildoers will be cut off, but those who wait for Yahweh-- they will possess [the] land.
passages.37:10: And<note: Or "But"> yet a little [while] and the wicked will not be, and you will look carefully upon his place, but he will not be.
passages.37:11: But [the] afflicted will possess [the] land, and they will take pleasure in an abundance of peace.
passages.37:12: [The] wicked plans [evil] against the righteous, and gnashes at him [with] his teeth.
passages.37:13: [The] Lord laughs at him, for he sees that his day is coming.
passages.37:14: [The] wicked have drawn [the] sword and have bent their bow to throw down [the] poor and [the] needy, to kill [those] upright in [their] way.
passages.37:15: Their sword will enter into their [own] heart, and their bows shall be broken.
passages.37:16: [The] little belonging to the righteous [is] better than [the] wealth of many wicked.
passages.37:17: For [the] arms of [the] wicked shall be broken, but Yahweh supports [the] righteous.
passages.37:18: Yahweh knows [the] days of [the] blameless, and their inheritance will be forever.
passages.37:19: They will not be put to shame in distressing times,<note: Hebrew "time"> and in [the] days of famine they will be satisfied.
passages.37:20: But [the] wicked will perish, and the enemies of Yahweh [will be] like [the] splendor of [the] pastures. They vanish; in smoke they vanish.
passages.37:21: [The] wicked borrows and does not repay, but [the] righteous [is] gracious and gives.
passages.37:22: For those blessed [by] him shall possess [the] land, but those cursed [by] him shall be cut off.
passages.37:23: [The] steps of a man are established by Yahweh, and he takes pleasure in his way.
passages.37:24: Though he fall, he will not be cast headlong, for Yahweh supports [him with] his hand.
passages.37:25: I was a youth, but I am [now] old; yet I have not seen [the] righteous forsaken or his children {begging for}<note: Literally "searching"> bread.
passages.37:26: All the day he [is] gracious and lends, and his children [are] a blessing.
passages.37:27: Turn aside from evil and do good and [so] abide forever.
passages.37:28: For Yahweh loves justice and will not forsake his faithful ones. They are protected forever. But [the] children of [the] wicked will be cut off.
passages.37:29: [The] righteous will possess [the] land and abide in it forever.
passages.37:30: [The] mouth of [the] righteous utters wisdom, and his tongue speaks justice.
passages.37:31: The law of his God [is] in his heart. His steps will not slip.
passages.37:32: [The] wicked watches for the righteous and seeks to kill him.
passages.37:33: Yahweh will not abandon him into his hand, and he will not let him be condemned when he is judged.
passages.37:34: Wait for Yahweh and keep his way, and he will exalt you to possess [the] land. When [the] wicked are cut off, you will see [it].
passages.37:35: I have seen [the] wicked acting violently and spreading himself out like a luxuriant native tree.
passages.37:36: Then he passed on<note: Dead Sea Scrolls and the versions read "I passed by"> and behold, he was not. And I sought him, but he could not be found.
passages.37:37: Observe [the] blameless and look at [the] upright, for [there is] a future for a man of peace.
passages.37:38: But transgressors shall be destroyed altogether. [The] future of [the] wicked shall be cut off.
passages.37:39: And<note: Some manuscripts omit "and," preserving the acrostic> [the] salvation of [the] righteous [is] from Yahweh, their refuge in [the] time of trouble.
passages.37:40: And Yahweh helps them and he rescues them. He rescues them from [the] wicked and saves them, because they take refuge in him.
passages.38:title: A psalm of David. To bring to remembrance.<note: The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by one>
passages.38:1: O Yahweh, do not rebuke me in your anger or chastise me in your wrath.
passages.38:2: For your arrows have sunk into me, and your hand has pressed down on me.
passages.38:3: There is no soundness in my flesh because of your indignation. There is no health in my bones because of my sin.
passages.38:4: For my iniquities have passed over my head; like a heavy burden they are too heavy for me.
passages.38:5: My wounds start to stink; they rot because of my foolishness.
passages.38:6: I am bowed down; I am bent over greatly. All the day I go about mourning.
passages.38:7: For my loins are full [of] burning, and there is no soundness in my flesh.
passages.38:8: I am faint and crushed greatly; I groan because of the roaring of my heart.
passages.38:9: O Lord, all my longing is before you, and my sighing is not hidden from you.
passages.38:10: My heart throbs violently, my strength leaves me; and the light of my eyes, that also is not with me.
passages.38:11: My friends and companions stand aloof from my affliction, and my relatives stand afar off.
passages.38:12: Those who seek my life lay snares as well, and those intent on my harm speak threats. They also plot deceit all day.
passages.38:13: But as for me, like [the] deaf I cannot hear, and [I am] like [the] mute [who] cannot open his mouth.
passages.38:14: And [so] I am like a man who hears not, and in whose mouth there are no retorts.
passages.38:15: Rather for you I wait, O Yahweh. You will answer, O Lord my God.
passages.38:16: For I said, "[Help,] lest they rejoice over me, [lest] they boast against me when my foot slips."
passages.38:17: For I [am] ready to stumble, and my pain [is] before me continually.
passages.38:18: For my iniquity I confess; I am anxious because of my sin.
passages.38:19: And my enemies without cause<note: Or "vigorous"> are numerous, and those who hate me wrongfully<note: Or "those who hate me [with] falsehood"> are many.
passages.38:20: And those who repay evil in return for good accuse me in return for my pursuing good.
passages.38:21: Do not forsake me, O Yahweh. O my God, do not be far from me.
passages.38:22: Hurry to help me, O Lord, my salvation.
passages.39:title: For the [music] director. For Jeduthun.<note: One of David's musicians (1 Chr 16:41)> A psalm of David.<note: The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by one>
passages.39:1: I said, "I will guard my ways {that I may not sin}<note: Literally "from sinning"> with my tongue. I will keep a muzzle over my mouth as long as [the] wicked [are] before me."
passages.39:2: I was mute [with] silence. I was silent [even] from [saying] good [things], and my pain was stirred up.
passages.39:3: My heart grew hot inside me; in my sighing a fire burned. [Then] I spoke with my tongue,
passages.39:4: "Let me know, O Yahweh, my end, and what is the measure of my days. Let me know how transient I [am]."
passages.39:5: Look, you have made my days [mere] handbreadths, and my lifespan as nothing next to you. Surely every person standing firm [is] complete vanity. Selah
passages.39:6: Surely a man walks about as a [mere] {shadow};<note: Literally "image"> surely in vain they bustle about. He heaps up [possessions] but does not know who [will] gather them [in].
passages.39:7: And now, O Lord, for what do I wait? My hope is for you.
passages.39:8: From all my transgressions deliver me; do not make me [the] taunt of [the] fool.
passages.39:9: I am mute. I do not open my mouth, for you, yourself, have done [it].
passages.39:10: Remove from me your affliction. By the opposition of your hand I perish.
passages.39:11: [When] with rebukes you chastise a man for sin, you<note: Hebrew "and/then you"> {consume}<note: Literally "cause to melt"> like a moth his delightful [things]. Surely everyone [is] a [mere] vapor.<note: The word translated "vanity" in vv. 6, 7> Selah
passages.39:12: Hear my prayer, O Yahweh, and listen [to] my cry for help; do not be deaf to my tears. For I [am] an alien<note: Or "stranger"> with you, a sojourner like all my ancestors.<note: Or "fathers">
passages.39:13: Look [away] from me that I may be cheerful, before I depart and I am no more.
passages.40:title: For the [music] director. Of David. A psalm.<note: The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by one>
passages.40:1: I waited patiently for Yahweh, And he inclined to me and heard my cry for help.
passages.40:2: And [so] he brought me up from [the] roaring pit,<note: Some read "pit of destruction"> from the miry clay. And he put my feet upon a rock; he made my steps steady.
passages.40:3: Then he put a new song in my mouth, a praise to our God. Many will see and fear, and will trust Yahweh.
passages.40:4: Blessed [is] the man who makes Yahweh his trust and does not turn to [the] proud and [to those who] fall away [to] a lie.<note: Or "false god">
