passages.107:33: He turns rivers into a wilderness and springs of water into thirsty ground,
passages.107:34: a fruitful land into a salty place, because of the evil of its inhabitants.
passages.107:35: He turns a wilderness into a pool of water and a dry land into springs of water.
passages.107:36: And he settles [the] hungry there, so that they may establish a city to inhabit,
passages.107:37: and sow fields and plant vineyards, {that they may yield fruit at harvest}.<note: Hebrew "and make a fruit of produce">
passages.107:38: And he blesses them and they multiply greatly, and he does not let their cattle become few.
passages.107:39: When they become few and they are bent down from [the] oppression of calamity and grief,
passages.107:40: [he] pours contempt on princes and causes them to wander in a trackless waste.
passages.107:41: But he protects<note: The sense is that of making something inaccessibly high, like a fortress> [the] needy from misery, and he makes [their] families like a flock.
passages.107:42: [The] upright see [it] and are glad, and all wickedness shuts its mouth.
passages.107:43: Whoever [is] wise, then let him observe these [things], and let them consider Yahweh's acts of loyal love.
passages.108:title: A song. A psalm of David.<note: The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by one>
passages.108:1: My heart [is] steadfast, O God. I will sing and give praise, even [with] my glory.
passages.108:2: Awake, harp and lyre. I will awake [the] dawn.<note: Or "I will awake at dawn">
passages.108:3: I will give you thanks among the peoples, O Yahweh; I will give you praise among the nations,
passages.108:4: because your loyal love [is] great above [the] heavens, and your faithfulness [reaches] to [the] clouds.
passages.108:5: Be exalted above [the] heavens, O God, and [let] your glory [be] above all the earth,
passages.108:6: so that your beloved ones may be rescued. Save by your right hand and answer me.
passages.108:7: God has spoken in his holiness, "I will exult, I will divide up Shechem, and portion out the valley of Succoth.
passages.108:8: Gilead [is] mine. Manasseh [is] mine. And Ephraim [is] the {helmet for}<note: Literally "protection of"> my head. Judah [is] my scepter;<note: Or "commander's rod">
passages.108:9: Moab [is] my washing pot. Over Edom I will cast my sandal; Over Philistia I will shout in triumph."
passages.108:10: Who will bring me to [the] fortified city? Who will lead me to Edom?
passages.108:11: Have you not rejected us, O God, and not gone out with our armies, O God?
passages.108:12: Give us help against [the] enemy, for the help of humankind [is] futile.
passages.108:13: Through God we will do valiantly,<note: Hebrew "do might"> and [it is] he [who] will tread down our enemies.
passages.109:title: For the [music] director. A psalm of David.<note: The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm>
passages.109:1: O God of my praise, do not keep silent,
passages.109:2: for {wicked and deceitful mouths}<note: Literally "a wicked mouth and a deceitful mouth"> have opened against me. They speak to me with a lying tongue.
passages.109:3: They also surround me with words of hate, and fight me without cause.
passages.109:4: In return for my love they accuse me, though I [am in] prayer.<note: Or perhaps "I [have] a plea [of innocence]">
passages.109:5: So they inflicted evil against me in return for good and hatred in return for my love.
passages.109:6: Appoint over him a wicked [man], and let an accuser stand at his right [hand].
passages.109:7: When he is judged, let him come out guilty, and let his prayer<note: Or perhaps "plea [of innocence]"> become as sin.
passages.109:8: Let his days be few; let another take his office.
passages.109:9: Let his children be orphans, and his wife a widow,
passages.109:10: and let his children wander aimlessly and beg, and let them plead from their ruins.
passages.109:11: Let [the] creditor seize all that [is] his, and let strangers plunder his property.
passages.109:12: Let there be none [who] extend to him loyal love, nor any who pities his orphans.
passages.109:13: Let his descendants<note: Or "posterity"; Hebrew is singular> be cut off. Let their name be blotted out in [the] next generation.
passages.109:14: Let the iniquity of his ancestors<note: Or "fathers"> be remembered before Yahweh, and let the sin of his mother not be blotted out.
passages.109:15: Let them be before Yahweh continually, that he may cut off their<note: That is, the family> memory from [the] earth,
passages.109:16: because he did not remember to show loyal love, but he pursued anyone,<note: Hebrew "a man"> poor or needy or brokenhearted, to slay [them].
passages.109:17: Because he loved cursing, let it come [upon] him. Because he did not delight in blessing, let it be far from him.
passages.109:18: Because he wore a curse as his robe, let it enter {his body}<note: Literally "his inward part"> like water, and into his bones like oil.
passages.109:19: May it be for him like a garment [in which] he wraps, and a belt {he continually wears}.<note: Literally "continually he girds it">
passages.109:20: Let this [be] the punishment for my accusers from Yahweh, even those who speak evil against my life.
passages.109:21: But you, O Yahweh my Lord, deal with me for your name's sake. Because your loyal love [is] good, deliver me,
passages.109:22: for I [am] poor and needy, and my heart is wounded within me.
passages.109:23: Like a lengthening shadow I am passing away; I am shaken off like a locust.
passages.109:24: My knees {buckle}<note: Literally "stumble"> from fasting, and my body grows lean without fat.
passages.109:25: And [so] I am a disgrace to them; [when] they see me, they shake their heads.<note: Hebrew "head">
passages.109:26: Help me, O Yahweh my God; save me according to your loyal love,
passages.109:27: that they may know that this [is] your hand, [that] you, O Yahweh, you have done it.
passages.109:28: Let them curse, but you bless. [When] they arise, let them be put to shame, that your servant may be glad.
passages.109:29: Let my accusers put on disgrace, and let them cover [themselves] with their shame as with a robe.
passages.109:30: I will give thanks to Yahweh exceedingly with my mouth, and in [the] midst of many I will praise him,
passages.109:31: for he stands at [the] right [hand] of [the] needy, to save [him] from those judging his life.<note: Or "soul">
passages.110:title: Of David. A psalm.<note: The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm>
passages.110:1: A declaration of Yahweh to my lord, "Sit at my right [hand] until I make your enemies your footstool."
passages.110:2: Yahweh will send out your mighty scepter from Zion; rule in the midst of your enemies.
passages.110:3: Your people {will volunteer}<note: Literally "will [be] freewill offerings"; see the related verbal form in Judg 5:2> in the day of your power.<note: Or "day of your army," or "day of battle"> In holy splendor, from [the] womb of [the] dawn, you will have the dew of your youth.<note: The meaning of this verse is obscure>
passages.110:4: Yahweh has sworn and he will not change [his mind], "You [are] a priest forever according to the manner of Melchizedek."
passages.110:5: O Lord, at your right [hand] he will shatter kings in the day of his anger.
passages.110:6: He will judge among the nations; he will fill [them] with corpses. He will shatter [the] {rulers}<note: Literally "head"> of many countries.
passages.110:7: He will drink from [the] stream by the road; therefore he will lift up [his] head.
passages.111:1: Praise Yah!<note: Hebrew hallelujah> I will give thanks to Yahweh with all [my] heart, in [the] assembly of [the] upright and [the] congregation.
passages.111:2: The works of Yahweh [are] great, studied<note: Or "pondered"> by all [who] delight [in] them.
passages.111:3: [Full of] splendor and majesty [is] his work, and his righteousness endures forever.
passages.111:4: He has made his wonders {to be remembered};<note: Literally "a remembrance"> Yahweh [is] gracious and compassionate.
passages.111:5: He gives food to those who fear him; he remembers his covenant forever.
passages.111:6: He has declared the power of his works for his people, by giving to them [the] inheritance of [the] nations.
passages.111:7: The works of his hands [are] faithfulness and justice; all his precepts [are] reliable.
passages.111:8: [They are] sustained forever [and] ever, done with faithfulness and uprightness.
passages.111:9: He has sent redemption to his people; he has commanded his covenant forever; holy and fearful [is] his name.
passages.111:10: The fear of Yahweh [is the] beginning of wisdom; all who do them<note: That is, his precepts (v. 7), or the stipulations of his covenant (v. 9)> have a good understanding. His praise endures forever.
passages.112:1: Praise Yah!<note: Hebrew hallelujah> Blessed [is the] man [who] fears Yahweh; he takes great delight in his commands.
passages.112:2: His {descendants}<note: Literally "seed"> will be mighty in the land; [the] generation of [the] upright will be blessed.
passages.112:3: Wealth and riches [are] in his house, and his righteousness endures forever.
passages.112:4: [His] light rises in the darkness for the upright; [he is] gracious and compassionate and righteous.
passages.112:5: [It goes] well [for] a man [who] is gracious and lends, [who] conducts his {business properly}.<note: Literally "matters in justice">
passages.112:6: For he will not be shaken forever; [the] righteous {will be remembered forever}.<note: Literally "will be for an eternal remembrance">
passages.112:7: He is not afraid of bad news; his heart [is] steadfast, secure<note: Or "full of trust"> in Yahweh.
passages.112:8: His heart [is] sustained; he will not be afraid, until he looks [in triumph] on his enemies.
passages.112:9: {He gives lavishly}<note: Literally "He distributes freely, he gives"> to the needy; his righteousness endures forever. His horn rises high in honor.
passages.112:10: [The] wicked<note: Singular> sees [it] and is vexed. He gnashes his teeth and {becomes weak}.<note: Literally "and melts"> [The] desire of [the] wicked<note: Plural> perishes.
passages.113:1: Praise Yah!<note: Hebrew hallelujah> Praise, O servants of Yahweh, praise the name of Yahweh.
passages.113:2: Let the name of Yahweh be blessed, from now until forever.
passages.113:3: From [the] rising of [the] sun to its setting, [let] the name of Yahweh be blessed.
passages.113:4: Yahweh [is] high above all nations; his glory [is] above the heavens.
passages.113:5: Who [is] like Yahweh our God, who [is] enthroned on high,<note: Or "who dwells on high">
passages.113:6: who {condescends to look at}<note: Hebrew "makes low to see"> [what is] in the heavens and in the earth?
passages.113:7: [He] raises [the] helpless from [the] dust; he lifts [the] needy from [the] ash heap,
passages.113:8: to seat [them] with princes, with the princes of his people.
passages.113:9: [He] causes the barren woman of the house to dwell [as] the happy mother of children. Praise Yah!<note: Hebrew hallelujah>
passages.114:1: When Israel went out from Egypt, the house of Jacob from a people of a strange language,
passages.114:2: Judah became his sanctuary, Israel his dominion.
passages.114:3: The sea looked and fled; the Jordan turned back.
passages.114:4: The mountains skipped like rams, [the] hills like {lambs}.<note: Literally "sons of [the] flock">
passages.114:5: What's with you, O sea, [that] you fled? O Jordan, [that] you turned back?
passages.114:6: O mountains, [that] you skipped like rams? O hills, like lambs?
passages.114:7: At the presence of [the] Lord writhe, O earth,<note: Or "O land"> at the presence of the God of Jacob,
passages.114:8: who turned the rock into a pool of water, flinty stone into a spring of water.
passages.115:1: Not to us, O Yahweh, not to us, but to your name give glory, because of your loyal love, because of your faithfulness.
passages.115:2: Why should the nations say, "Where, {pray tell},<note: Literally "please"> [is] their God?"
passages.115:3: But our God [is] in the heavens; all that he desires, he does.
passages.115:4: Their idols [are] silver and gold, [the] work of human hands.
passages.115:5: They have mouths, but cannot speak; they have eyes, but cannot see;
passages.115:6: they have ears, but cannot hear; they have noses, but cannot smell;
passages.115:7: [they have] their hands, but they cannot feel, their feet, but they cannot walk; they cannot utter a sound in their throats.
passages.115:8: [Those who] make them become like them, [as does] everyone who trusts in them.
passages.115:9: O Israel, trust Yahweh; he [is] their help and their shield.
passages.115:10: O house of Aaron, trust in Yahweh; he [is] their help and their shield.
passages.115:11: [You who] fear Yahweh, trust in Yahweh; he [is] their help and their shield.
passages.115:12: Yahweh remembers us; he will bless [us]. He will bless the house of Israel; he will bless the house of Aaron.
passages.115:13: He will bless [those who] fear Yahweh, the small with the great.
passages.115:14: May Yahweh give you increase, you and your children.
passages.115:15: May you be blessed by Yahweh, who made heaven and earth.
passages.115:16: The heavens [are] Yahweh's heavens, but the earth he has given to [the] children of humankind.
passages.115:17: The dead do not praise Yah,<note: A shortened form of "Yahweh"> nor any descending into silence.
passages.115:18: [It is] we, we will bless Yah<note: A shortened form of "Yahweh"> from now until forever. Praise Yah!<note: Hebrew hallelujah>
passages.116:1: I love [him], because Yahweh has heard {the voice of my supplications}.<note: Literally "my voice, my supplications">
passages.116:2: Because he has inclined his ear to me, I will call {all my days}.<note: Literally "in my days">
passages.116:3: [The] ropes of death encircled me, and the distresses of Sheol found me. I found trouble and grief.
passages.116:4: Then I called on the name of Yahweh: "O Yahweh, please save my life!"
passages.116:5: Gracious [is] Yahweh and righteous, and our God [is] merciful.
passages.116:6: Yahweh watches over [the] simple. I was brought low, but he gave me victory.
passages.116:7: Return, O my soul, to your repose, for Yahweh has dealt bountifully with you.
passages.116:8: For you have rescued me<note: Hebrew "my soul." If "soul" is accepted, then "death" means "[the place of] death," that is, the netherworld.> from death, my eyes<note: Hebrew "eye"> from tears, my feet from stumbling.
passages.116:9: I will walk before Yahweh in the land<note: Hebrew "lands"> of the living.
passages.116:10: I believed when I spoke, "I am afflicted greatly."
passages.116:11: I said in my haste, "{Everyone}<note: Literally "All [of] the humankind"> [is] a liar."
passages.116:12: What shall I give back to Yahweh [for] all his benefits to me?
passages.116:13: I will lift up [the] cup of salvation and proclaim the name of Yahweh.
passages.116:14: I will pay my vows [made] to Yahweh in the presence of all his people.
passages.116:15: Costly {in Yahweh's view}<note: Literally "in the eyes of Yahweh"> [is] the death of his faithful [ones].
passages.116:16: Ah, Yahweh, I [am] indeed your servant; I am your servant, the child of your maidservant. You have loosed my bonds.
passages.116:17: I will offer to you a sacrifice of thanksgiving, and proclaim the name of Yahweh.
passages.116:18: I will pay my vows [made] to Yahweh in the presence of all his people,
passages.116:19: in the courts of the house<note: Or "temple"> of Yahweh, in the midst of you, O Jerusalem. Praise Yah!<note: Hebrew hallelujah>
passages.117:1: Praise Yahweh, all you nations; extol him, all you peoples.
passages.117:2: For his loyal love [is] mighty on our behalf, and the faithfulness of Yahweh [is] forever. Praise Yah!<note: Hebrew hallelujah>
passages.118:1: Give thanks to Yahweh for [he is] good, for his loyal love [is] forever.
passages.118:2: Let Israel say, "His loyal love [is] forever."
passages.118:3: Let the house of Aaron say, "His loyal love [is] forever."
passages.118:4: Let [those who] fear Yahweh say, "His loyal love [is] forever."
passages.118:5: Out of [my] distress I called to Yah.<note: A shortened form of "Yahweh"> Yah answered me, [setting me] in a broad place.
passages.118:6: Yahweh [is] for me; I do not fear. What can [mere] humans<note: Or "humankind"> do to me?
passages.118:7: Yahweh [is] for me as my helper, and [so] I will look [in triumph] on those who hate me.
passages.118:8: [It is] better to take refuge in Yahweh than to trust in humans.<note: Or "humankind">
passages.118:9: [It is] better to take refuge in Yahweh than to trust princes.
passages.118:10: All nations surrounded me. In the name of Yahweh I opposed them indeed.
passages.118:11: They surrounded me; yes, they surrounded me. In the name of Yahweh I opposed them indeed.
passages.118:12: They surrounded me like bees; they were extinguished like a fire of thorns. In the name of Yahweh I opposed them indeed.
passages.118:13: You pushed me hard<note: Hebrew intensive "pushing, you pushed me"> to [make me] fall, but Yahweh helped me.
passages.118:14: Yah<note: A shortened form of "Yahweh"> [is] my strength and [my] song,<note: Or "[my] might"> and he has become my salvation.<note: Or "victory">
passages.118:15: [The] sound of rejoicing and salvation<note: Or "victory"> [is] in [the] tents of [the] righteous; the right hand of Yahweh [has] done valiantly.
passages.118:16: The right hand of Yahweh [has] exalted; the right hand of Yahweh [has] done valiantly.
passages.118:17: I will not die but live, and tell of the works of Yah.<note: A shortened form of "Yahweh">
passages.118:18: Yah has disciplined me severely, but he did not consign<note: Hebrew "give"> me to death.
passages.118:19: Open to me [the] gates of righteousness, that I may enter through them [and] give thanks to Yah.<note: A shortened form of "Yahweh">
passages.118:20: This [is] the gate of Yahweh, through [which the] righteous will enter.
passages.118:21: I will give thanks [to] you for you have answered me, and you have become my salvation.<note: Or "victory">
passages.118:22: [The] stone the builders rejected has become [the] chief cornerstone.
passages.118:23: This is from Yahweh; it is wonderful in our eyes.
passages.118:24: This [is] the day Yahweh has worked;<note: Or "made"> let us rejoice and be glad in him.<note: Or "in it">
passages.118:25: O Yahweh, please save; O Yahweh, please grant success.
passages.118:26: Blessed [is] he who comes in the name of Yahweh. We bless you<note: Hebrew plural> from the house<note: Or "temple"> of Yahweh.
passages.118:27: Yahweh is God, and he has given us light.<note: Or "made [his] light to shine upon [to] us"> Bind [the] festal sacrifice<note: Or "festal procession"> with cords<note: Or "branches"> to the horns<note: Or "[and lead up] to the horns"> of the altar.
passages.118:28: You [are] my God, and I will give thanks to you. [You are] my God; I will exalt you.
passages.118:29: Give thanks to Yahweh for [he is] good, for his loyal love [is] forever.
passages.119:1: Blessed [are those whose] way is blameless, who walk in the law of Yahweh.
passages.119:2: Blessed [are] those who keep his testimonies; they seek him with a whole heart.
passages.119:3: They also do no wrong; they walk in his ways.
passages.119:4: You have commanded<note: Perhaps emphatic; Hebrew "you, you have commanded"> your precepts, that [we] should keep [them] diligently.
passages.119:5: Oh that my ways were steadfast, to keep your statutes!
passages.119:6: Then I would not be ashamed when I look to all your commands.
passages.119:7: I will give you thanks with an upright heart, when I learn your righteous laws.
passages.119:8: I will heed your statutes; do not utterly forsake me.
passages.119:9: How can a young man keep his way pure? By taking heed according to your word.
passages.119:10: With my whole heart I have sought you; do not let me stray from your commands.
passages.119:11: In my heart I have hidden your word,<note: Or "promise"> so that I may not sin against you.
passages.119:12: Blessed [are] you, O Yahweh. Teach me your statutes.
passages.119:13: With my lips I have told [of] all the ordinances of your mouth.
passages.119:14: In the way of your testimonies I have rejoiced as [I would] over all riches.
passages.119:15: I will meditate on your precepts and look at<note: That is, "examine"> your ways.
passages.119:16: I will take delight in your statutes; I will not forget your word.
passages.119:17: Deal bountifully with your servant, that I may live and heed your word.
passages.119:18: Uncover my eyes, that I may look at<note: That is, "examine"> wonderful things from your law.
passages.119:19: I [am] a sojourner on the earth;<note: That is, "here for a short time"> do not hide your commands from me.
passages.119:20: My soul is crushed with longing for your ordinances at all times.
passages.119:21: You rebuke [the] arrogant, [the] accursed, who stray from your commands.
passages.119:22: {Remove from}<note: Literally "Roll off of"> me scorn and contempt, for I have kept your testimonies.
passages.119:23: Even [though] princes sit [and] speak against me, your servant meditates on your statutes.
passages.119:24: Your testimonies [are] my delight, {my counselors}.<note: Literally "the men of my counsel">
passages.119:25: My soul clings to the dust; revive me according to your word.
passages.119:26: I told of my ways, and you answered me; teach me your statutes.
passages.119:27: Make me understand the way of your precepts, that I may meditate on your wonderful things.
passages.119:28: My soul weeps<note: Or "is sleepless"> because of grief; strengthen me according to your word.
passages.119:29: Remove from me [the] deceptive way, and graciously give me your law.
passages.119:30: I have chosen [the] faithful way; I have set your ordinances [before me].
passages.119:31: I cling to your testimonies; O Yahweh, do not let me be put to shame.
passages.119:32: I will run the way of your commands, for you will enlarge my heart.<note: That is, "give greater understanding">
passages.119:33: Teach me, O Yahweh, the way of your statutes, and I will keep it to the end.
passages.119:34: Give me understanding, that I may keep your law and heed it with [my] whole heart.
passages.119:35: Cause me to walk in the path of your commands, for I delight in it.
passages.119:36: Incline my heart to your testimonies, and not to [dishonest] gain.
passages.119:37: Turn away my eyes from looking at [what is] worthless; revive me in your ways.
passages.119:38: Fulfill your word<note: Or "your promise"> to your servant, which [is] to [bring about] a reverence for you.
passages.119:39: Turn away my disgrace that I dread, for your ordinances [are] good.
passages.119:40: Look, I have longed for your precepts; revive me in your righteousness.
passages.119:41: Let your acts of loyal love also come to me, O Yahweh, your salvation according to your word.<note: Or "your promise">
passages.119:42: Then I will have an answer [for the] one who taunts me, for I trust your word.
passages.119:43: And do not snatch [the] word of truth utterly from my mouth, for I hope in your ordinances.
passages.119:44: So I will heed your law continually, forever and ever.
passages.119:45: And I will go about {freely},<note: Literally "in the wide place"> for I have sought your precepts.
passages.119:46: And I will speak of your testimonies before kings, and will not be ashamed.
passages.119:47: And I will take delight in your commands, which I love.
passages.119:48: And I will lift up my hands<note: Hebrew "palms"> to your commands, which I love, and I will meditate on your statutes.
passages.119:49: Remember [your] word to your servant, upon which you have caused me to hope.
passages.119:50: This [is] my comfort in my misery: that your word<note: Or "your promise"> preserves my life.
passages.119:51: [The] arrogant utterly deride me; I have not turned aside from your law.
passages.119:52: I remember your ordinances of old, O Yahweh, and I take comfort.
passages.119:53: Rage seizes me because of [the] wicked, those who forsake your law.
passages.119:54: Your statutes have been my songs in the house of my sojourning.
passages.119:55: I remember your name in the night, O Yahweh, and I heed your law.
passages.119:56: This has been mine, that I have kept your precepts.
passages.119:57: Yahweh [is] my portion; I intend to heed your words.
passages.119:58: I {seek your favor}<note: Literally "entreat your face"> with my whole heart; be gracious [to] me according to your word.<note: Or "your promise">
passages.119:59: I think about my ways, and turn my feet to your testimonies.
passages.119:60: I hurry and do not delay to heed your commands.
passages.119:61: [The] cords of [the] wicked surround me, [but] I do not forget your law.
passages.119:62: [In the] middle of [the] night I rise to give you thanks, because of your righteous ordinances.
passages.119:63: I [am] a companion of all [who] fear you and heed your precepts.
passages.119:64: The earth, O Yahweh, is full of your loyal love. Teach me your statutes.
passages.119:65: You have dealt well with your servant, O Yahweh, according to your word.
passages.119:66: Teach me good discernment and knowledge, for I believe your commands.
passages.119:67: Before I was afflicted, I was going astray, but now I heed your word.
passages.119:68: You [are] good and do good; teach me your statutes.
passages.119:69: [The] arrogant smear me with lies;<note: Hebrew "lie"> I keep your precepts with [my] whole heart.
passages.119:70: Their heart [is] insensitive like fat;<note: See Isa 6:10 for a similar idea, but a different word for "fat"> As for me, I take delight in your law.
passages.119:71: [It is] good for me that I was afflicted, so that I might learn your statutes.
passages.119:72: The law of your mouth [is] better to me than thousands of gold and silver [coins].
passages.119:73: Your hands have made me and established me; give me understanding that I may learn your commands.
passages.119:74: Those who fear you will see me and be glad, because I hope in your word.
passages.119:75: I know, O Yahweh, that your judgments [are] right, and [that] in faithfulness you afflicted me.
passages.119:76: Please let your loyal love comfort me, according to your word<note: Or "your promise"> to your servant.
passages.119:77: Let your mercies come [to] me, that I may live, for your law [is] my delight.
passages.119:78: Let the arrogant be put to shame, because they have wronged me [with] lies.<note: Hebrew "lie"> As for me, I will meditate on your precepts.
passages.119:79: Let those who fear you turn to me, even those who know<note: According to the reading tradition (Qere)> your testimonies.
passages.119:80: May my heart be blameless in your statutes, so that I may not be ashamed.
passages.119:81: My soul languishes for your salvation; I hope in your word.
passages.119:82: My eyes long for<note: Or "long [to see]"> your word,<note: Or "your promise"> saying, "When will you comfort me?"
passages.119:83: For I have become like a wineskin in [the] smoke, [yet] I have not forgotten your statutes.
passages.119:84: How many [are] the days of your servant? When will you execute justice against those who persecute me?
passages.119:85: [The] arrogant have dug pits<note: That is, traps> for me, which [is] not according to<note: Or "who [are] not in accord with"> your law.
passages.119:86: All your commands [are] faithful. They persecute me deceitfully; help me!
passages.119:87: They have almost destroyed me on the earth, but I have not forsaken your precepts.
passages.119:88: According to your loyal love preserve me alive, so that I may heed the testimony from your mouth.
passages.119:89: Forever, O Yahweh, your word {is settled}<note: Literally "stands firm"> in heaven.
passages.119:90: Your faithfulness [endures] {throughout all generations}.<note: Literally "for a generation and a generation"> You have established [the] earth and it stands.
passages.119:91: By your ordinances they stand today, for all [are] your servants.
passages.119:92: Unless your law [had been] my delight, then I would have perished in my misery.
passages.119:93: I will not ever forget your precepts, for by them you revive me.<note: Or "give me life">
passages.119:94: I [am] yours. Save me, for I have sought your precepts.
passages.119:95: For me [the] wicked [lie in] wait to destroy me. I give attention to your testimonies.
passages.119:96: I have seen a limit to every perfection;<note: The meaning of this line is uncertain.> your command [is] very broad.
passages.119:97: How I love your law! The whole day it [is] my meditation.
passages.119:98: Your commands make me wiser than my enemies, because they<note: Hebrew "it [is]"> [are] ever with me.
passages.119:99: I have more insight than all my teachers, for your testimonies [are] my meditation.
passages.119:100: I understand more than [the] elders, for I keep your precepts.
passages.119:101: I have restrained my feet from every evil way, so that I may heed your word.
passages.119:102: I have not turned aside from your ordinances, for you have taught me.
passages.119:103: How smooth<note: Or "sweet"> [are] your words<note: Hebrew "word"> to my palate, more than honey in my mouth.
passages.119:104: From your precepts I get understanding, therefore I hate every false way.
passages.119:105: Your word [is] a lamp to my feet and a light to my path.
passages.119:106: I have sworn [an oath] and confirmed [it], to heed {your righteous ordinances}.<note: Literally "the ordinances of your righteousness">
passages.119:107: I am very much afflicted; O Yahweh, revive me according to your word.
passages.119:108: Please accept the freewill offerings of my mouth, O Yahweh, and teach me your ordinances.
passages.119:109: My life [is] {in danger}<note: Literally "in my hand"> continually, yet I do not forget your law.
passages.119:110: [The] wicked have laid a snare for me, yet I do not wander from your precepts.
passages.119:111: I have taken as my own your testimonies forever, for they [are] the joy of my heart.
passages.119:112: I have inclined my heart to do your statutes forever, to the end.
passages.119:113: I hate {the double-minded},<note: Literally "[the] divided"> but I love your law.
passages.119:114: You [are] my hiding place and my shield; I hope in your word.
passages.119:115: Turn aside from me, [you] evildoers, for I will keep the commands of my God.
passages.119:116: Sustain me according to your word,<note: Or "promise"> that I may live, and do not let me be ashamed of my hope.
passages.119:117: Uphold me, that I may be delivered, and have regard for your statutes continually.
passages.119:118: You reject all [who] stray from your statutes, for their deceit [is] a breach of faith.
passages.119:119: You remove all the wicked of [the] earth [like] dross, therefore I love your testimonies.
passages.119:120: My flesh trembles for fear of you, and I am afraid of your judgments.
passages.119:121: I have done justice and righteousness;<note: Or "done [what is] proper and right"> do not leave me to my oppressors.
passages.119:122: Pledge good for your servant; do not let [the] arrogant oppress me.
passages.119:123: My eyes long for<note: Or "long [to see]"> your salvation, and your righteous word.<note: Or "promise">
passages.119:124: Deal with your servant according to your loyal love, and teach me your statutes.
passages.119:125: I [am] your servant; give me understanding, that I may know your statutes.
passages.119:126: [It is] time for Yahweh to act,<note: Or "time to act, O Yahweh"> [for] they have broken your law.
passages.119:127: Therefore I love your commands more than gold, even fine gold.
passages.119:128: Therefore all [your] precepts of everything I regard as right; I hate every false way.
passages.119:129: Your testimonies [are] miracles, therefore my soul keeps them.
passages.119:130: The unfolding of your words gives light, giving understanding to [the] simple.
passages.119:131: I open my mouth and pant, because I long for your commands.
passages.119:132: Turn to me and be gracious to me, as [is] proper for those who love your name.
passages.119:133: Direct my steps in your word,<note: Or "through your promise"> and do not let any iniquity gain power over me.
passages.119:134: Redeem me from [the] oppression of humankind, that I may heed your precepts.
passages.119:135: Shine your face on your servant, and teach me your statutes.
passages.119:136: Streams of water flow down [from] my eyes, because [people] do not heed your law.
passages.119:137: You [are] righteous, O Yahweh, and your ordinances [are] upright.
passages.119:138: You have ordained your testimonies [in] righteousness, and [in] exceeding faithfulness.
passages.119:139: My zeal consumes me, because my enemies have forgotten your words.
passages.119:140: Your word [is] very pure, and your servant loves it.
passages.119:141: I [am] small and despised, [yet] I do not forget your precepts.
passages.119:142: Your righteousness [is] an everlasting righteousness, and your law [is] truth.
passages.119:143: Trouble and anguish have found me; your commands delight me.
passages.119:144: The righteousness of your testimonies [is] forever; give me understanding that I may live.
passages.119:145: I call with [my] whole heart; answer me, O Yahweh. I will keep your statutes.
passages.119:146: I call to you. Save me, and I will heed your testimonies.
passages.119:147: I rise early in the dawn and cry for help; I hope in your word.<note: According to the reading tradition (Qere)>
passages.119:148: My eyes anticipate [the] night watches, that [I may] meditate on your word.
passages.119:149: Hear my voice according to your loyal love; O Yahweh, preserve my life according to your justice.
passages.119:150: [Those who] pursue a [wicked] purpose draw near; they are far from your law.
passages.119:151: You [are] near, O Yahweh, and all your commands [are] truth.
passages.119:152: Concerning your testimonies, I knew long ago that you have established them forever.
passages.119:153: See my misery and rescue me, for I do not forget your law.
passages.119:154: Plead my cause and redeem me; preserve my life according to your word.<note: Or "promise">
passages.119:155: Salvation [is] far from [the] wicked, for they do not seek your statutes.
passages.119:156: Your mercies [are] great, O Yahweh; preserve my life according to your ordinances.
passages.119:157: My persecutors and enemies [are] many, [yet] I do not turn aside from your testimonies.
passages.119:158: I see [the] treacherous and I feel disgust, because they do not heed your word.
passages.119:159: Consider<note: Hebrew "See"> that I love your precepts; O Yahweh, according to your loyal love preserve my life.
passages.119:160: The {whole}<note: Literally "head"> of your word [is] truth, and your every righteous judgment [endures] forever.
passages.119:161: Princes persecute me without cause, but my heart trembles because of your word.<note: According to the reading tradition (Qere)>
passages.119:162: I [am] rejoicing over your word, like one who finds great spoil.
passages.119:163: I hate and abhor falsehood; I love your law.
passages.119:164: I praise you seven [times] in the day for your righteous ordinances.
passages.119:165: Great peace [is] for those who love your law, and they do not have a cause for stumbling.
passages.119:166: I hope for your salvation, O Yahweh, and do your commands.
passages.119:167: My soul heeds your testimonies, and I love them exceedingly.
passages.119:168: I heed your precepts and testimonies, because all my ways [are] before you.
passages.119:169: Let my cry come before you, O Yahweh; give me understanding according to your word.
passages.119:170: Let my plea come before you; Deliver me according to your word.<note: Or "promise">
passages.119:171: Let my lips pour out praise, because you teach me your statutes.
passages.119:172: Let my tongue sing [of] your word,<note: Or "promise"> because all your commands [are] right.
passages.119:173: Let your hand be my help,<note: Hebrew "to help me"> because I have chosen your precepts.
passages.119:174: I long for your salvation, O Yahweh, and your law [is] my delight.
passages.119:175: Let my soul<note: Or "my life"> live that it may praise you, and let your ordinances help me.
passages.119:176: I have wandered like a lost sheep; seek your servant, because I do not forget your commands.
passages.120:title: A song of ascents.<note: The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm>
passages.120:1: In my distress I called to Yahweh, and he answered me.
passages.120:2: "Deliver my life, O Yahweh, from lying lips, from a deceitful tongue."
passages.120:3: What shall be given to you,<note: That is, by God against the false accuser> and what more shall be done to you, deceitful tongue?
passages.120:4: [The] sharpened arrows of a warrior, with burning charcoals from broom trees.
passages.120:5: Woe to me, that I sojourn in Meshech, [that] I dwell among the tents of Kedar.
passages.120:6: Too long my soul has had its dwelling near [one who] hates peace.
passages.120:7: I [am for] peace, but when I speak, they [are] for war.
passages.121:title: A song for the ascents.<note: The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm>
passages.121:1: I lift up my eyes to the mountains; whence will my help come?
passages.121:2: My help [is] from Yahweh, maker of heaven and earth.
passages.121:3: He will not allow your foot to be moved; he who protects you will not slumber.
passages.121:4: Look, he will not slumber and he will not sleep-- he who protects Israel.
passages.121:5: Yahweh [is] your protector; Yahweh [is] your shade at your right hand.
passages.121:6: The sun will not strike you by day, nor [the] moon by night.
passages.121:7: Yahweh will protect you from all evil;<note: Or "all calamity"> he will protect your life.
passages.121:8: Yahweh will protect your going out and your coming in from now until forever.
passages.122:title: A song of ascents. Of David.<note: The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm>
passages.122:1: I rejoiced in [those who] said to me, "Let us go to the house<note: Or "temple"> of Yahweh."
passages.122:2: Our feet are standing within your gates, O Jerusalem--
passages.122:3: Jerusalem that is built as a city that is joined together,
passages.122:4: where [the] tribes go up, the tribes of Yah<note: A shortened form of "Yahweh"> [as] a testimony for Israel, to give thanks to the name of Yahweh.
passages.122:5: For there [the] thrones sit<note: That is, rulers or judges on thrones> for judgment, thrones of David's house.
passages.122:6: Pray<note: Hebrew "Ask"> for the peace of Jerusalem: "May those who love you be at ease.
passages.122:7: May peace be within your walls, security within your palaces."
passages.122:8: For the sake of my brothers and my friends, I will say, "Peace [be] within you."
passages.122:9: For the sake of the house<note: Or "temple"> of Yahweh our God, I will seek your good.
passages.123:title: A song of ascents.<note: The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm>
passages.123:1: I lift up my eyes to you, the one enthroned<note: Or "the one who dwells"> in the heavens.
passages.123:2: Behold, as [the] eyes of servants [look] to the hand of their master,<note: Hebrew "masters"> as [the] eyes of a maid to the hand of her mistress, so our eyes [look] to Yahweh our God, until he is gracious to us.
passages.123:3: Be gracious to us, O Yahweh, be gracious to us, for long enough we have had our fill of contempt.
passages.123:4: For long enough our soul has had its fill of the derision of the self-confident, the contempt of [the] arrogant.
passages.124:title: A song of ascents. Of David.<note: The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm>
passages.124:1: "If [it had] not [been] Yahweh who was on our side," do let Israel say,
passages.124:2: "If [it had] not [been] Yahweh who was on our side, when men rose up against us,
passages.124:3: then they would have swallowed us alive, when their anger was kindled against us.
passages.124:4: Then the waters would have flooded over us, [the] torrent would have passed over our soul.
passages.124:5: Then over our soul would have passed the raging waters."
passages.124:6: Blessed [be] Yahweh, who has not made<note: Hebrew "given"> us prey for their teeth.
passages.124:7: Our soul has escaped like a bird from [the] snare of fowlers. The snare [is] broken, and we have escaped.
passages.124:8: Our help [is] in the name of Yahweh, maker of heaven and earth.
passages.125:title: A song of ascents.<note: The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm>
passages.125:1: Those who trust in Yahweh [are] like Mount Zion, which cannot be moved, [but] abides forever.
passages.125:2: [As] mountains [are] round about Jerusalem, so Yahweh [is] round about his people, from now until forever.
passages.125:3: For the scepter of wickedness shall not rest on the {land}<note: Literally "lot," that is, land allotted> of the righteous, lest the righteous stretch out their hands to do wickedness.<note: Hebrew "in wickedness">
passages.125:4: Do good, O Yahweh, to the good, and to [those] upright in their hearts.
passages.125:5: But regarding those who turn aside to their crooked ways, Yahweh will lead them away with the evildoers. Peace [be] upon Israel.
passages.126:title: A song of ascents.<note: The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm>
passages.126:1: When Yahweh restored the fortunes<note: Or "captivity"> of Zion,<note: Or "[those] returned of [belonging to] Zion"> we were like dreamers.
passages.126:2: Then our mouth was filled with laughter, and our tongue with rejoicing. Then they said among the nations, "Yahweh has done great [things] for these [people]."
passages.126:3: Yahweh has done great [things] for us; we are glad.
passages.126:4: Restore, O Yahweh, our fortunes<note: Or "captivity"> like the streams in the Negeb.<note: Or "South">
passages.126:5: Those who sow with tears shall reap with rejoicing.
passages.126:6: He who diligently goes [out] with weeping, carrying the seed bag, shall certainly come [in] with rejoicing, carrying his sheaves.
passages.127:title: A song of ascents. Of Solomon.<note: The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm>
passages.127:1: Unless Yahweh builds a house, its builders labor at it in vain. Unless Yahweh guards a city, a guard watches in vain.
passages.127:2: [It is] in vain for you who rise early [and] sit late, eating the bread of anxious toil, [when] thus he<note: That is, Yahweh> provides<note: Hebrew "gives"> for his beloved in [his] sleep.<note: Or "so he gives sleep to his beloved">
passages.127:3: Look, children<note: Hebrew "sons"> [are] the heritage<note: That is, gift> of Yahweh; the fruit of the womb [is] a reward.
passages.127:4: Like arrows in [the] hand of a warrior, so [are] the children<note: Hebrew "sons"> of [one's] youth.
passages.127:5: Blessed [is] the man who fills his quiver with them.<note: Or "whose quiver he [Yahweh] fills with them"> They shall not be put to shame when they speak with enemies at the gate.
passages.128:title: A song of ascents.<note: The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm>
passages.128:1: Blessed [is] everyone who fears Yahweh, who walks in his ways.
passages.128:2: You will indeed eat of the labor of your hands; you [will be] happy and [it will be] well with you.
passages.128:3: Your wife [will be] like a fruitful vine {within}<note: Literally "in the recesses of"> your house. Your children<note: Hebrew "sons"> [will be] like olive shoots about your table.
passages.128:4: Look, for thus shall a man be blessed {who fears Yahweh}.<note: Literally "a fearer of Yahweh">
passages.128:5: May Yahweh bless you from Zion, that you may see the good of Jerusalem all the days of your life,
passages.128:6: and that you may see your children's children. [May] peace [be] upon Israel.
passages.129:title: A song of ascents.<note: The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm>
passages.129:1: "Too often<note: Or "Greatly"> they have attacked me from my youth." Let Israel say,
passages.129:2: "Too often<note: Or "Greatly"> they have attacked me from my youth, yet they have not prevailed against me.
passages.129:3: On my back plowmen have plowed. They have made their furrows<note: According to the reading tradition (Qere)> long."
passages.129:4: Yahweh [is] righteous. He has cut [the] ropes<note: That is, the yoke and tackle on a beast of burden> of [the] wicked.
passages.129:5: Let all be put to shame and repulsed who hate Zion.
passages.129:6: Let them be like grass on [the] housetops, that withers before it grows up,
passages.129:7: [with] which a reaper cannot fill his hand, nor the binder of sheaves his {arms},<note: Literally "bosom">
passages.129:8: so that passersby do not say, "The blessing of Yahweh [be] upon you. We bless you in the name of Yahweh."
passages.130:title: A song of ascents.<note: The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm>
passages.130:1: Out of [the] depths I call to you, O Yahweh.
passages.130:2: "O Lord, hear my voice. Let your ears be attentive to the voice of my supplications.
passages.130:3: If you, O Yah,<note: A shortened form of "Yahweh"> should {keep track of}<note: Literally "keep"> iniquities, O Lord, who could stand?
passages.130:4: But with you [is] forgiveness, so that you may be feared."
passages.130:5: I await Yahweh; my soul awaits, and I wait<note: Or "hope," here and v. 7, though the Hebrew uses a different verbal stem in v. 7> for his word.
passages.130:6: My soul [waits] for the Lord more than watchmen for the morning. Yes, [more than] watchmen for the morning.
passages.130:7: O Israel, wait<note: Or "hope"> for Yahweh. For with Yahweh [there is] loyal love, and with him [there is] abundant redemption.
passages.130:8: And he will redeem Israel from all its iniquities.
passages.131:title: A song of ascents. Of David.<note: The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm>
passages.131:1: My heart is not haughty nor my eyes {arrogant}.<note: Literally "raised"> And I do not {concern myself}<note: Literally "walk about"> with things too great and difficult for me.
passages.131:2: Rather I have soothed and quieted my soul, like a weaned child with its mother, like the weaned child [is] my soul with me.
passages.131:3: O Israel, hope in Yahweh from now until forever.
passages.132:title: A song of ascents.<note: The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm>
passages.132:1: O Yahweh, remember with regard to David all his affliction.<note: Hebrew "his being afflicted">
passages.132:2: How he swore to Yahweh, he vowed to the Mighty One of Jacob:
passages.132:3: "I will not enter into the tent of my house, I will not go up to the couch of my bed,
passages.132:4: I will give no sleep to my eyes, [no] slumber to my eyelids,
passages.132:5: until I find a place for Yahweh, a dwelling place for the Mighty One of Jacob."
passages.132:6: Look, we heard of it in Ephrathah; we found her in the fields of Jaar.<note: Or "the fields of the woods">
passages.132:7: Let us go to his dwelling places;<note: That is, the temple> Let us worship at his footstool.
passages.132:8: Arise, O Yahweh, to your resting place, you and your mighty ark.
passages.132:9: Let your priests clothe themselves with righteousness, and let your faithful sing for joy.
passages.132:10: For the sake of your servant David, do not turn away the face of your anointed one.
passages.132:11: Yahweh swore [in] truth to David; he will not turn back from it. "One from the fruit of your {body}<note: Literally "belly"> I will set on your throne.
passages.132:12: If your sons will heed my covenant and my testimonies that I will teach them, their sons also forever will sit on your throne."
passages.132:13: For Yahweh has chosen Zion; he has desired it for his habitation.
passages.132:14: "This [is] my resting place forever; here I will dwell, for I have desired it.
passages.132:15: I will bless its provisions abundantly; I will satisfy its poor with bread.
passages.132:16: I will also clothe its priests with salvation, and its faithful will shout exuberantly for joy.
passages.132:17: There I will cause a horn to grow for David; I will set a lamp for my anointed one.
passages.132:18: I will clothe his enemies with shame, but on him his crown will flourish."<note: Or "shine">
passages.133:title: A song of ascents. Of David.<note: The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm>
passages.133:1: Look, how good and how pleasant [it is] [when] brothers dwell together in unity.
passages.133:2: [It is] like the fragrant oil upon the head, running down upon the beard, the beard of Aaron, that runs down upon the edges of his robes.
passages.133:3: [It is] like the dew of Hermon that runs down upon the mountains of Zion, because there Yahweh commanded the blessing-- life forever.
passages.134:title: A song of ascents.<note: The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm>
passages.134:1: Look, bless Yahweh, all [you] the servants of Yahweh, who {serve}<note: Literally "stand"> in the house<note: Or "temple"> of Yahweh by night.
passages.134:2: Lift up your hands in [the] sanctuary and bless Yahweh.
passages.134:3: May Yahweh bless you from Zion, [he who] made heaven and earth.
passages.135:1: Praise Yah!<note: Hebrew hallelujah> Praise the name of Yahweh. Praise [him], O servants of Yahweh,
passages.135:2: who stand in the house<note: Or "temple"> of Yahweh, in the courts of the house<note: Or "temple"> of our God.
passages.135:3: Praise Yah,<note: A shortened form of "Yahweh"> for Yahweh [is] good. Sing praises concerning his name, for [it is] pleasant.
passages.135:4: For Yah has chosen Jacob for himself, Israel as his special possession.
passages.135:5: For I know that Yahweh [is] great, and our Lord [is greater] than all gods.
passages.135:6: All that Yahweh desires, he does, in heaven and on earth, in the seas and all [the] depths.
passages.135:7: [He] causes clouds to rise from the edge of the earth; he makes lightnings for the rain; [he] brings out [the] wind from his storehouses.
passages.135:8: Who struck the firstborn of Egypt, both of humans<note: Hebrew "human"> and animals.<note: Hebrew "animal">
passages.135:9: He sent signs and wonders into your midst, O Egypt, against Pharaoh and all his servants.
passages.135:10: Who struck many nations and killed mighty kings--
passages.135:11: Sihon the king of the Amorites, and Og the king of Bashan, and all the kingdoms of Canaan--
passages.135:12: and he gave their land as an inheritance, an inheritance for his people Israel.
passages.135:13: O Yahweh, your name [endures] forever, your {renown}<note: Literally "remembrance"> {throughout all generations},<note: Literally "for a generation and a generation">
passages.135:14: for Yahweh will plead [the] cause [of] his people and will have compassion on his servants.
passages.135:15: The idols of the nations [are] silver and gold, [the] work of the hands of humankind.
passages.135:16: They have mouths, but cannot speak; they have eyes, but cannot see;
passages.135:17: they have ears, but cannot hear; there is not even breath in their mouths.
passages.135:18: [Those who] make them become like them, [as does] everyone who trusts in them.
passages.135:19: O house of Israel, bless Yahweh. O house of Aaron, bless Yahweh.
passages.135:20: O house of Levi, bless Yahweh. [You who] fear Yahweh, bless Yahweh.
passages.135:21: Blessed [be] Yahweh from Zion, who dwells [in] Jerusalem. Praise Yah!<note: Hebrew hallelujah>
passages.136:1: Give thanks to Yahweh, for [he is] good, for his loyal love [endures] forever.
passages.136:2: Give thanks to the God of gods, for his loyal love [endures] forever.
passages.136:3: Give thanks to the Lord of lords, for his loyal love [endures] forever.
passages.136:4: To [him who] alone does great wonders, for his loyal love [endures] forever.
passages.136:5: To [him who] made the heavens with skill,<note: Or "understanding"> for his loyal love [endures] forever.
passages.136:6: To [him who] spread out the earth above the waters, for his loyal love [endures] forever.
passages.136:7: To [him who] made [the] great lights, for his loyal love [endures] forever.
passages.136:8: The sun to rule the day, for his loyal love [endures] forever.
passages.136:9: The moon and stars to rule the night, for his loyal love [endures] forever.
passages.136:10: To [him who] struck Egypt through their firstborn, for his loyal love [endures] forever.
passages.136:11: And he brought Israel out from among them, for his loyal love [endures] forever.
passages.136:12: With a strong hand and an outstretched arm, for his loyal love [endures] forever.
passages.136:13: To [him who] divided [the] {Red Sea}<note: Literally "sea of reed"> in two, for his loyal love [endures] forever.
passages.136:14: And he let Israel cross over through the midst of it, for his loyal love [endures] forever.
passages.136:15: But he tossed Pharaoh and his army into [the] {Red Sea},<note: Literally "sea of reed"> for his loyal love [endures] forever.
passages.136:16: To [him who] led his people through the wilderness, for his loyal love [endures] forever.
passages.136:17: To [him who] struck great kings, for his loyal love [endures] forever.
passages.136:18: And he killed mighty kings, for his loyal love [endures] forever.
passages.136:19: Sihon the king of the Amorites, for his loyal love [endures] forever.
passages.136:20: And Og the king of Bashan, for his loyal love [endures] forever.
passages.136:21: And he gave their land as an inheritance, for his loyal love [endures] forever.
passages.136:22: An inheritance to Israel his servant, for his loyal love [endures] forever.
passages.136:23: Who remembered us in our low estate, for his loyal love [endures] forever.
passages.136:24: And he rescued us from our enemies, for his loyal love [endures] forever.
passages.136:25: [The one who] gives food to all flesh, for his loyal love [endures] forever.
passages.136:26: Give thanks to the God of heaven, for his loyal love [endures] forever.
passages.137:1: By the rivers of Babylon, there we sat, yes, we wept, when we remembered Zion.
passages.137:2: On [the] willows<note: Species of tree uncertain> in her midst, we hung up our lyres.
passages.137:3: For there our captors asked of us words of a song, and our tormentors<note: Only occurring once in the MT, this interpretation is uncertain. The LXX's "carried us captive" is a guess. If related to the Hebrew root yll it might have the idea of "mockers/yammerers"> [asked of us] jubilation, "Sing for us from a song of Zion."
passages.137:4: How could we sing the song of Yahweh in {a foreign land}?<note: Literally "a land of a foreigner">
passages.137:5: If I forget you, O Jerusalem, let my right hand forget.<note: That is, how to play a musical instrument>
passages.137:6: Let my tongue cling to the roof of my mouth, if I do not remember you, if do not I exalt Jerusalem above my highest joy.
passages.137:7: Remember, O Yahweh, against the sons of Edom the day of Jerusalem, the ones who said, "Lay [it] bare! Lay [it] bare to its foundation!"
passages.137:8: O daughter of Babylon, about to be devastated, happy [shall be he] who pays back to you {what you paid out to us}.<note: Literally "[with] what you treated us">
passages.137:9: Happy [shall be he] who seizes and smashes your children against the rock.
passages.138:title: Of David.<note: The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm>
passages.138:1: I give you thanks with my whole heart; before [the] gods I sing your praise.
passages.138:2: I bow down toward your holy temple and give thanks to your name, because of your loyal love and faithfulness, for you have magnified your word<note: Or "promise"> according to all your name.<note: Or "beyond all your name">
passages.138:3: {When}<note: Literally "In the day"> I called and you answered me, you emboldened me in my soul [with] strength.
passages.138:4: All [the] kings of [the] earth will praise you, O Yahweh, when they have heard the words<note: Or "heard about the words"> of your mouth,
passages.138:5: and they will sing of the ways of Yahweh, because Yahweh's glory [is] great.
passages.138:6: Though Yahweh [is] high, yet he sees [the] lowly, but [the] proud he perceives<note: Hebrew "knows"> at a distance.
passages.138:7: Though I walk in the midst of trouble, you preserve me alive. You stretch out your hand against the anger of my enemies, and you save me [with] your right hand.
passages.138:8: Yahweh accomplishes [things] for my benefit. O Yahweh, your loyal love [endures] forever; do not abandon the works of your hands.
passages.139:title: For the [music] director. Of David. A psalm.<note: The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm>
passages.139:1: O Yahweh, you have searched me, and you know [me].
passages.139:2: You know my sitting down and my rising up. You understand my thought from afar.
passages.139:3: You search out<note: Hebrew "winnow"; or perhaps from another root, "measure"> my wandering and my lying down, and are acquainted with all my ways.
passages.139:4: For [there is] not a word [yet] on my tongue, [but] behold, O Yahweh, you know it completely.
passages.139:5: You barricade me behind and in front, and set your hand upon me.
passages.139:6: [Such] knowledge is too wonderful for me. It is set high; I cannot [prevail] against it.
passages.139:7: Where I can go from your Spirit, or where can I flee from your presence?
passages.139:8: If I ascend to heaven, there you [are], and if I make my bed [in] Sheol, look! [There] you [are].
passages.139:9: If I lift up [the] wings of [the] dawn, [and] I alight on [the] far side of [the] sea,
passages.139:10: even there your hand would lead me, and your right hand would hold me fast.
passages.139:11: And if I should say, "Surely darkness will cover me, and [the] light around me [will be as] night,"
passages.139:12: even [the] darkness is not too dark for you,<note: Or "does not obscure from you"> and [the] night shines as the day-- the darkness [and] the light are alike [for you].
passages.139:13: Indeed you created my {inward parts};<note: Literally "kidneys"> you wove me in my mother's womb.
passages.139:14: I praise you, because I am fearfully [and] wonderfully [made].<note: Or "I am made wonderful fearfully"> Wonderful [are] your works, and my soul knows [it] well.
passages.139:15: My {frame}<note: Literally "bone"> was not hidden from you, when I was created secretly,<note: Or "in the secret [place]"> [and] intricately woven in [the] depths of [the] earth.
passages.139:16: Your eyes saw my embryo,<note: Hebrew "unformed substance"> and in your book they all were written-- days fashioned [for me] when [there was] not one of them.
passages.139:17: And to me, how precious<note: Or "difficult"> are your thoughts, O God; how vast is their sum.
passages.139:18: If I should count them, they would outnumber [the] sand. I awaken, and I [am] still with you.
passages.139:19: If only you would kill the wicked, O God-- so get away from me, [you] {bloodthirsty men}--<note: Literally "men of bloods">
passages.139:20: who speak against you deceitfully. Your enemies take [your name] in vain.
passages.139:21: Do I not hate those who hate you, O Yahweh? And do I [not] loathe those who rise up against you?
passages.139:22: I hate them with a complete hatred; they have become my enemies.
passages.139:23: Search me, O God, and know my heart; test me and know my anxious thoughts.
passages.139:24: And see if [there is] in me {the worship of false gods},<note: Literally "a way of an idol"> and lead me in [the] way everlasting.
passages.140:title: For the [music] director. A psalm of David.<note: The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by one>
passages.140:1: Rescue me, O Yahweh, from evil men.<note: The several uses of the singular "man" in this psalm are probably collective> Preserve me from violent men,
passages.140:2: who plan evil [things] in [their] heart. They stir up wars continually.
passages.140:3: They sharpen their tongue as [sharp as] a snake's; [the] venom of a viper [is] under their lips. Selah
passages.140:4: Protect me, O Yahweh, from [the] hands of [the] wicked. Preserve me from violent men, who have planned to {make me stumble}.<note: Literally "push my steps">
passages.140:5: [The] proud have hidden a trap for me, and cords. They have spread out a net along [the] {side}<note: Literally "hand"> of [the] path. They have set snares for me. Selah
passages.140:6: I say to Yahweh, "You [are] my God." Listen, O Yahweh, to the voice of my supplications.
passages.140:7: O Yahweh, my Lord, the strength of my salvation, you have covered my head in [the] day of battle.
passages.140:8: Do not grant, O Yahweh, [the] desires of [the] wicked. Do not allow [them] to attain their<note: Hebrew "his"> plan, lest they be exalted. Selah
passages.140:9: [With respect to the] head of [those who] surround me, may the harm of their lips cover them.
passages.140:10: Let burning coals fall on them; let them be dropped into the fire, into bottomless pits [from which] they cannot rise.
passages.140:11: Do not let a {slanderer}<note: Literally "man of tongue"> be established in the land; as for [the] man of violence, let evil hunt him quickly.
passages.140:12: I know<note: According to the reading tradition (Qere)> that Yahweh will maintain [the] cause of [the] afflicted, [and] justice for [the] needy.
passages.140:13: Surely [the] righteous will give thanks to your name; [the] upright will dwell in your presence.
passages.141:title: A psalm of David.<note: The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm>
passages.141:1: I call on you, O Yahweh; hasten to me. Listen to my voice when I call to you.
passages.141:2: Let my prayer be set before you [as] incense, the lifting up of my palms [as the] evening offering.
passages.141:3: Set a guard, O Yahweh, over my mouth; keep watch over the door of my lips.
passages.141:4: Do not incline my heart to any evil thing, to practice wicked deeds with men [who] do iniquity; and do not let me eat of their delicacies.
passages.141:5: Let a righteous one strike me in kindness, and let him chasten me. [It is] oil for [my] head;<note: Or "It is choice oil"> let not my head refuse. For still my prayer [is] against their evil deeds.
passages.141:6: [When] their judges are thrown down [the] sides of a cliff,<note: Or "are dropped into the hands of [the] Rock," that is, Yahweh. The interpretation of vv. 6-7 is uncertain.> then they will understand that my words were pleasant.
passages.141:7: As [when one] plows and breaks up the earth, [so] our bones are scattered at the mouth of Sheol.
passages.141:8: But<note: Or "Because"> my eyes [are] toward you, O Yahweh, my Lord; I have taken refuge in you. Do not lay bare my soul.<note: Or "Do not raze my life">
passages.141:9: Protect me from [the] {grasp}<note: Literally "hand"> of [the] trap they have laid for me, and [from the] snares of evildoers.
passages.141:10: Let [the] wicked fall into their<note: Hebrew "his"> nets, while I escape altogether.
passages.142:title: A maskil of David. When he was in the cave. A prayer.<note: The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by one>
passages.142:1: I cry out with my voice to Yahweh; I implore favor with my voice to Yahweh.
passages.142:2: I pour out my complaint before him; I declare my trouble before him.
passages.142:3: When my spirit faints within me, you know my way. On the path where I walk, they have hidden a trap for me;
passages.142:4: look to [my] right and see. There is no one looking out for me; there is no escape for me;<note: Hebrew "a refuge has perished from me"> no one cares for my soul.<note: Or "life">
passages.142:5: I cry out to you, O Yahweh. I say, "You [are] my refuge, my portion in the land of the living."
passages.142:6: Attend to my cry, for I am brought very low. Deliver me from my pursuers, for they are stronger than I.
passages.142:7: Bring me<note: Hebrew "my soul"> out of prison, that I may give thanks to your name. [The] righteous will encircle me, because you will deal bountifully with me.
passages.143:title: A psalm of David.<note: The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm>
passages.143:1: O Yahweh, hear my prayer; listen to my supplications. In your faithfulness answer me, [and] in your righteousness.
passages.143:2: And do not enter into judgment with your servant, because no one alive [is] righteous before you.
passages.143:3: For [the] enemy has pursued my soul; he has crushed my life to the ground. He has made me dwell in dark places like [those] long dead.
passages.143:4: And [so] my spirit grows faint within me; my heart {within}<note: Literally "in the midst of"> me is desolate.
passages.143:5: I remember [the] days of long ago; I meditate on all your doings.<note: Hebrew "doing"> I muse on the labor of your hands.
passages.143:6: I stretch out my hands to you; my soul [longs] for you like a dry land. Selah
passages.143:7: Quickly answer me, O Yahweh; my spirit fails. Do not hide your face from me, or I will become like [those] descending to [the] pit.
passages.143:8: Cause me to hear your loyal love in the morning, for I trust you. Cause me to know the way that I should go, for I lift up my soul to you.
passages.143:9: Deliver me from my enemies, O Yahweh. I take refuge in you.<note: This reading for the difficult Hebrew "I cover to you" is suggested by the LXX>
passages.143:10: Teach me to do your will, for you [are] my God; your Spirit [is] good. Lead me onto level ground.
passages.143:11: For your name's sake, O Yahweh, preserve my life; in your righteousness bring me<note: Hebrew "my soul"> out of trouble.
passages.143:12: And in your loyal love destroy my enemies, and exterminate all [the] adversaries of my soul, for I [am] your servant.
passages.144:title: Of David.<note: The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm>
passages.144:1: Blessed be Yahweh, my rock, the one who trains my hands for battle, my fingers for war--
passages.144:2: my loyal love and my fortress, my stronghold and my deliverer, my shield, and [one] in whom I take refuge, the one who subdues peoples<note: Reading with many Hebrew manuscripts and versions; MT reads "my people"> under me.
passages.144:3: O Yahweh, what [is] humankind that you take knowledge of him, [or the] son of man that you take thought of him?
passages.144:4: Humankind is like a breath, his days like a passing shadow.
passages.144:5: O Yahweh, bow the heavens and come down; touch the mountains so that they smoke.
passages.144:6: Flash forth lightning and scatter them; dispatch your arrows and rout them.
passages.144:7: Stretch out your hands from on high; Rescue me and deliver me from many waters, from [the] hand of foreigners,
passages.144:8: whose mouth speaks falsely, and their right hand [is] a false right hand.
passages.144:9: O God, I will sing a new song to you. With a lyre of ten [strings] I will sing praise to you,
passages.144:10: who gives victory to kings, who rescues David his servant from [the] evil sword.
passages.144:11: Rescue me and deliver me from [the] hand of foreigners, whose mouth speaks falsely, and whose right hand [is] a false right hand,
passages.144:12: that our sons [may be] like plants, full grown in their youth, our daughters like corner pillars, carved in the style of a palace,
passages.144:13: [that] our granaries [may be] full, providing [produce] of all kinds,<note: Hebrew "from kind to kind"> [that] our sheep [may] produce by the thousands, by the tens of thousands in our open fields,
passages.144:14: [that] our cattle [may be] pregnant; [that there be] no breach [in our walls], and no going out [in exile], and no outcry in our plazas.
passages.144:15: Blessed [are] the people who have [it] thus. Blessed [are] the people whose God [is] Yahweh.
passages.145:title: A praise of David.<note: The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm>
passages.145:1: I will exalt you, my God, O king, and I will bless<note: That is, praise; here and v. 2> your name forever and ever.
passages.145:2: Every day I will bless you and praise your name forever and ever.
passages.145:3: Great [is] Yahweh, and very worthy of praise, and his greatness is unsearchable.
passages.145:4: One generation will laud your works to another, and will declare your mighty deeds.
passages.145:5: On the splendor of the glory of your majesty, and on your wonderful deeds, I will meditate.
passages.145:6: And they will speak of the power of your awesome deeds,<note: That is, deeds that evoke a fearful reverence> and I will tell of your greatness.<note: According to the reading tradition (Qere)>
passages.145:7: They will utter <note: Hebrew "pour forth"> the renown of your abundant goodness, and they will proclaim with joy your righteousness.
passages.145:8: Yahweh [is] gracious and compassionate, {slow to anger}<note: Literally "long of nostrils"> and great in loyal love.
passages.145:9: Yahweh [is] good to all, and his mercies [are] over all his works.
passages.145:10: All your works will praise you, O Yahweh, and your faithful ones will bless<note: That is, praise> you.
passages.145:11: They will speak of the glory of your kingdom, and talk of your power,
passages.145:12: to make known to the children of humankind his mighty deeds, and the glory of the majesty of his kingdom.
passages.145:13: Your kingdom [is] an everlasting kingdom, and your dominion [endures] {throughout all generations}.<note: Literally "for a generation and a generation">
passages.145:14: Yahweh upholds all who are falling, and raises up all who are bowed down.
passages.145:15: [The] eyes of all look hopefully to you, and you give them their food in due time,
passages.145:16: opening your hand, and satisfying [the] desire [of] every living creature.
passages.145:17: Yahweh [is] righteous in all his ways, and loyal in all his works.
passages.145:18: Yahweh [is] near to all who call on him, to all who call on him in truth.
passages.145:19: He fulfills the desire of those who fear him; he also hears their cry for help, and saves them.
passages.145:20: Yahweh protects all those who love him, but all the wicked he will exterminate.
passages.145:21: My mouth will speak the praise of Yahweh, and all flesh will bless his holy name forever and ever.
passages.146:1: Praise Yah.<note: Hebrew hallelujah> Praise Yahweh, O my soul.
passages.146:2: I will praise Yahweh while I live; I will sing praises to my God while I [am] still [alive].
passages.146:3: Do not place trust in princes, in a son of humankind with whom there is no deliverance.
passages.146:4: His breath departs; he returns to his plot;<note: A Hebrew wordplay: "humankind," adam (v. 3), returns to his ground/plot, adamah> on that day his plans perish.
passages.146:5: Blessed [is the one] whose help [is] the God of Jacob, whose hope [is] on Yahweh [as] his God,
passages.146:6: who made heaven and earth, the sea and all that [is] in them, the one who keeps faith<note: Or "remains faithful"> forever,
passages.146:7: [who] executes justice for the oppressed, [who] gives food for the hungry. Yahweh sets prisoners free;
passages.146:8: Yahweh opens [the eyes of the] blind; Yahweh raises up [those] bowed down; Yahweh loves [the] righteous;
passages.146:9: Yahweh protects<note: Or "watches over"> [the] strangers. He helps up [the] orphan and [the] widow, but [the] way of [the] wicked he {thwarts}.<note: Literally "makes crooked">
passages.146:10: Yahweh will reign forever, Your God, O Zion, {throughout all generations}.<note: Literally "for a generation and a generation"> Praise Yah.<note: Hebrew hallelujah>
passages.147:1: Praise Yah.<note: Hebrew hallelujah; here and v. 20> For [it is] good to sing praises [to] our God; for [it is] pleasant; praise is fitting.
passages.147:2: Yahweh [is] building Jerusalem; he gathers [the] scattered ones of Israel.
passages.147:3: [He is] the one who heals the brokenhearted, and binds up their wounds.
passages.147:4: [He] counts [the] number of the stars; he gives names to all of them.
passages.147:5: Great [is] our Lord, and abundant in power; his understanding is unlimited.
passages.147:6: Yahweh helps the afflicted up; [he] brings [the] wicked down to [the] ground.
passages.147:7: Sing to Yahweh with thanksgiving; sing praises to our God with lyre,
passages.147:8: who covers [the] heavens with clouds, who provides rain for the earth, who causes grass to grow on the mountains.
passages.147:9: [He] gives to [the] animal its food, [and] to [the] young ravens that cry.
passages.147:10: He does not delight in the strength of the horse; he takes no pleasure in the legs of the man.
passages.147:11: Yahweh takes pleasure in those who fear him, the ones who hope<note: That is, "wait expectantly"> for his loyal love.
passages.147:12: Laud Yahweh, O Jerusalem; praise your God, O Zion,
passages.147:13: for he strengthens the bars of your gates. He blesses your children within you;
passages.147:14: [he] makes your border peaceful; he satisfies you with [the] {finest of wheat}.<note: Literally "[the] fat of the wheat">
passages.147:15: [He] sends out his command<note: Or "utterance"> to [the] earth; his word runs swiftly.
passages.147:16: [He] gives snow like wool; he scatters frost like ashes;
passages.147:17: [he] throws his hail like crumbs. Who can stand before his cold?<note: With slight alteration of the Hebrew, the line might read "before his cold water stands">
passages.147:18: He sends out his word and melts them; he blows his breath, the water flows.
passages.147:19: [He] declares his word to Jacob, his statutes and his ordinances to Israel.
passages.147:20: He has not done so for any nation, and they do not know [his] ordinances. Praise Yah.<note: Hebrew hallelujah>
passages.148:1: Praise Yah.<note: Hebrew hallelujah> Praise Yahweh from the heavens; praise him in the heights.
passages.148:2: Praise him, all his angels; praise him, all his hosts.<note: According to the reading tradition (Qere)>
passages.148:3: Praise him, sun and moon; praise him, all stars of light.
passages.148:4: Praise him, {highest heavens},<note: Literally "heaven[s] of the heavens"> and waters above the heavens.
passages.148:5: Let them praise the name of Yahweh, because he commanded and they were created.
passages.148:6: And he put them in place forever and ever, [by] a decree he gave that will not pass away.
passages.148:7: Praise Yahweh from the earth-- great sea creatures and all deeps,
passages.148:8: fire and hail, snow and cloud,<note: The meaning of "cloud" is uncertain> stormy wind doing his bidding,<note: Hebrew "his word">
passages.148:9: the mountains and all hills, fruit trees and all cedars,
passages.148:10: beasts and all cattle,<note: That is, wild and domesticated> creeping things and {flying birds},<note: Literally "bird of wing">
passages.148:11: kings of [the] earth and all peoples, princes and all judges of [the] earth,
passages.148:12: young men and young women as well, [the] old [together] with [the] young--
passages.148:13: let them praise the name of Yahweh, because his name alone [is] is exalted. His splendor [is] above earth and heavens.
passages.148:14: And he has raised high a horn for his people, praise for all his faithful-- for the children of Israel, a people close to him. Praise Yah.<note: Hebew hallelujah>
passages.149:1: Praise Yah.<note: Hebrew hallelujah> Sing to Yahweh a new song, his praise in [the] assembly of [the] faithful.
passages.149:2: Let Israel be glad in its maker; let the children of Zion rejoice in their king.
passages.149:3: Let them praise his name with dancing; let them sing praises to him with tambourine and lyre.
passages.149:4: For Yahweh takes pleasure in his people; he glorifies [the] afflicted with salvation.
passages.149:5: Let [the] faithful exult in glory; let them sing for joy on their beds.
passages.149:6: Let the extolling of God [be] in their throat, and a double-edged sword in their hand,
passages.149:7: to execute vengeance on the nations [and] punishment on [the] peoples,<note: Reading against the MT and with the LXX>
passages.149:8: to bind their kings with chains and their {nobles}<note: Literally "honorable ones"> with fetters of iron,
passages.149:9: to execute on them [the] judgment that is decreed.<note: Hebrew "written"> This [will be] honor for all his faithful ones; Praise Yah.<note: Hebrew hallelujah>
passages.150:1: Praise Yah.<note: Hebrew hallelujah> Praise God in his sanctuary; praise him in his mighty firmament.
passages.150:2: Praise him for his mighty deeds; praise him according to the abundance of his greatness.
passages.150:3: Praise him with blast of horn; praise him with harp and lyre.
passages.150:4: Praise him with tambourine and dancing; praise him with strings and flute.
passages.150:5: Praise him with sounding cymbals; praise him with clashing cymbals.
passages.150:6: Every breathing thing, let it praise Yah.<note: A shortened form of "Yahweh"> Praise Yah.<note: Hebrew hallelujah>
